loans.name: Cosmos

texts.en: Cosmos bought merchandise with his previous Kiva loan, which helped him grow. He has a store located in his home and things are going well for him. He is asking for a new Kiva loan so he can buy more food products to satisfy his customers’ needs and a second-hand motorcycle to help him in supplying his products. Having an assortment allows him to sell more and increase his working capital. His message to the Kiva lenders is, “Blessings for all of you and I wish you the best!"

loans.use: to buy food products for resale and a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Irungu

texts.en:
Irungu is 69 years old. A business man, he is widower with six adult children. He has been in the quarry business for the past 20 years with the monthly income of KES. 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Irungu will use the loan to buy another quarry plot and pay school fees for his son. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will keep goats and sheep. His hopes and dreams are to venture into the livestock keeping business.

loans.use: to buy another quarry plot and pay school fees for his son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of scratch cards (calling cards).

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is a mother of four grown children from Nazareth. She has a traveling store where she sells clothing, linens and undergarments. Originally Nabila decided to try and sell products from her car. She began with household items and supplies and then started with women’s clothes, undergarments sheets and towels after customer demand proved these to be the best selling items. Nabila has built up a steady flow of clientele and become known throughout the city.

Nabila is widening her merchandise and needed this loan for larger amounts of stock. She is able to buy in bulk and thus make a respectable profit on her resale

Nabila's items are good quality and she sells at competitive prices. With the ability to buy large quantities of the bestselling items, she is able to assure low buying costs which allow for decent profits while satisfying customers. She wants to continue and strengthen her business and branch out to another mobile store one day in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of stock, including women's clothing, undergarments, towels and linens.

loans.name: Eti

texts.en:
Eti lives in Ein Tamar. She manages two separate business activities that help support her family. First, she has a catering business which provides services to the municipality for special events. This business is seasonal but Eti has a strong reputation. Second, Eti herself is a skilled artist who decided to offer courses in different crafts and artistry. She is now opening classes in tapestry, mosaics and woodwork.

Eti needed this loan to renovate her studio. She is not new to managing a business, but understood she had the opportunity to take her skills and knowledge and apply them in a different area that could stabilize her monthly income. Eti wants to see her studio grow and provide both long term classes and one day lessons for locals and tourists alike.

loans.use: To pay for renovating her studio into a working classroom.

loans.name: Samhar

texts.en:
Samhar is a mother of two lovely children. She is from Sachnin. She has a hair salon and offers beauty treatments. Samhar is a determined woman who is dedicated to making a healthy living for her family. With the support of her husband, she took courses and gained expertise, which is appreciated by her customers.

Samhar needs this loan for renovations to her salon and for beauty and hair design supplies.

Samhar is dedicated to her business’ success. She has introduced inventive and effective marketing programs, including beauty memberships, birthday treatments and special giveaways during the slow season to draw customers. She dreams of opening a full-scale beauty salon one day, thus ensuring a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To pay for renovations to her salon and purchase beauty and hair design supplies.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín y tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y madre de 7 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se dedica a la venta de cereales y animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en si Banco Comunal por que allí aprendió y aún está aprendiendo más a mejorar en su negocio, también le permite distraerse ya que comparte sus experiencias con sus demás compañeras, ella dice que es muy bonito asistir a sus reuniones por que su promotora les hace reír y es bien amena. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá viajando a las ferias para comprar animales menores como patos, gallinas, cuyes y también cereales como trigo, maca, quiwicha para así venderlos en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Communal Bank Delfín and is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and makes a living selling grains and small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She likes the training the receives much in her Communal Bank because there she learned and is still learning more to improve her business. It also allows her to be distracted since she shares her experiences with the other members. She says that it is very nice to attend the meetings because her promoter makes them laugh is very entertaining. 

The loan she is requesting will be invested in traveling to the markets to buy small animals such as ducks, chickens and guinea pigs, as well as grains such as wheat, 'maca' (root vegetable from the Andes) and amaranth to then sell them in the market.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as ducks, chicken and guinea pis.

loans.name: Francis F.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Grafton, on the outskirts of Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to buy or invest in things that their mere salaries alone cannot let them do. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the deductions and the repayments on their behalf.

Francis is the leader of this group.  The 55-year-old is a native of Kailahun town. He is married to a housewife and the couple has six children. Francis has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like cement and iron corrugated zincs in order to augment his current house-building project.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like cement and iron corrugated zincs in order to augment his current house building project

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is widowed and has four children, two of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren and sister's children). Regina has operated a tailoring business for the last 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread and a new sewing machine. Regina doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She works seven days a week and sells at retail to all categories of people. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

Regina hopes to own a tailoring school and to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Regina's monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Janneth

texts.en:
Janneth is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya, and the mother of seven children, five of whom are adults. She has been farming for twenty years and currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. Janneth sells her produce, comprised mainly of maize, milk and horticultural products, to the local market. She also runs a secondhand clothes retail business and a cereal milling plant.

Janneth has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic that her businesses will pay with better returns and assist her in paying for the education of her two children still in school. Janneth says the major challenge occurs during high production seasons; however, this is not a major challenge for milk production though it is acute for farmers producing only cereals such as maize.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 60 años. Vive en compañía de sus inquilinos, quienes son como una familia. Su casa la compró hace 30 años y está ubicada en el asentamiento humano Justicia Paz y Vida.  
A pesar de su edad, continua trabajado muy arduo, “me siento muy ágil”, comenta. Su principal actividad consiste en la venta de gelatina, flan, leche asada y dulces en dos colegios de su localidad. Prepara los postres durante la mañana, los acomoda en una bandeja y en baldes, y se dirige a la escuela donde espera a la salida de los niños para ofrecer sus productos. Luego de vender lo necesario, se dirige a la otra escuela. Después de mucha caminata y esfuerzo termina su día, y después comienza a vender sus productos de belleza. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y espera poder tener las fuerzas para seguir haciéndolo.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, pues podrá concretar los objetivos de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que aprende mucho con los integrantes de su grupo.
Victoria invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de gelatinas, cucharas y vasos descartables, además de bolsas de plástico para preparar sus dulces.
texts.en:
Victoria, age 60, lives with her renters, who are like a family.  She bought her house 30 years ago, and it is located in the Justicia Paz y Vida human settlement.  In spite of her age she continues working very hard, “I feel very spry,” she says.

Her primary business activity is selling gelatin, flan, pudding, and sweets at two local schools.  She prepares the desserts in the morning.  She arranges them on a tray and in buckets.  She then heads to the school where she waits for the children to exit in order to sell her products.  After selling what she needs to, she heads to the other school.  After much walking and effort she finishes her day.

Then she starts to sell her beauty products.  She is a very hard-working woman, and she hopes to be able to have the strength to continue on this way.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the financial support she receives.  She will be able to achieve her objectives in her business. She pledges to be punctual with her payments since she learns a lot from the members of her group.

Victoria will use the requested money to buy gelatin, spoons, disposable glasses, and plastic bags in order to prepare her sweets.

loans.use: to buy gelatin and utensils in order to prepare her sweets.

loans.name: Rugiatu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Calaba town, in Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. Teachers of this school, like their colleague teachers in all SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to request loans. These loans are very helpful in helping them solve certain financial constrains that their mere salaries alone cannot let them solve. And at the end of each month, they repay their loans using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

James is the leader of this group of teachers. James is married with six children. He has served in the teaching profession for many years now. With the help of this loan, James is going to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Conseptor

texts.en:
Conseptor is a farmer and a mother of three children, two of whom are already adults with the last born being 13 years old. She has been in active farming for fourteen years in her rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya. Her farm produces tea, milk and eggs.

Conseptor has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She says the expansion of her poultry flock will improve her income significantly and enable her to meet her family needs with more ease.

She however notes that a lack of capital is a great limitation to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Allieu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Cassel Farm in Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to solicit a loan of 13,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Isatu is the leader of this group of teachers. The 45-year-old is a native of Freetown. She is married and has three school-going children. Isatu has been a teacher for many years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Moijueh J.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a secondary school in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers have come to Kiva lenders, through SMT, to request a loan. With the help of this loan, they are empowered to meet their immediate finacial challenges and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 

Moijueh is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kailahun about 46 years ago, he is married and has one child. Moijueh has been in the teaching profession for many years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy household equipment.

loans.use: to buy household equipment

loans.name: James Fefegula's Group

texts.en:
Above is a photo of some primary school teachers in Rokel, on the outskirts of Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Like their counterparts in other SMT operational areas, they have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan. With the help of this loan, they are empowered to meet certain financial challenges unattainable with only their salaries. At the end of each month, they repay Kiva lenders using their monthly salaries. Their school bursar is directly responsible for making the repayments on their behalf.

James is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is a native of Bonthe and has been serving as a teacher for many years. He is married and has 3 children. James has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials such as cement and corrugated roofing sheets for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as cement and corrugated roofing sheets

loans.name: Roberto Juvenal

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre de 43 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, caracterizada por su clima cálido y gente acogedora; Roberto siempre ha sido una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo por salir adelante y apoyar a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil; en sus ratos libre le gusta conducir y apreciar los hermosos paisajes de la ciudad.
Por iniciativa propia y con mucho empeño, desde hace varios años Roberto se desempeña como chofer de taxi, él cuenta con su propio vehículo el cual lo utiliza para trabajar, desde tempranas horas de la mañana Roberto sale a buscar pasajeros, él labora un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 40 clientes, Roberto se encuentra a gusto realizando su trabajo y cree que le va bien debido a su buen servicio y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Roberto se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un juego de llantas y parlantes para su vehículo; de esta manera Roberto contará con un auto en buena condiciones y podrá brindar un mejor servicio, así aumentará sus ingresos económicos con los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder adquirir otro auto para sí poder comenzar su gran sueño de tener una empresa de taxis.
texts.en:
Roberto is 43 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its hot climate and friendly people. Roberto has always been a kind, enthusiastic and hard-working person, who has a great desire to get ahead and support his family. Unfortunately, since he has to spend all his time working to pay his bills, he has not been able to pursue a professional career, though he would have liked to study civil engineering. In his free time, Roberto likes to drive around and take in the beautiful landscapes of his home city and region.

Of his own initiative and through his hard work, Roberto was able to start up a taxi service several years ago. He has his own car, and he starts driving early every morning to look for passengers. He works about 8 hours every day, and can attend up to 40 clients per day. Roberto enjoys his work, and believes that things are going well because he offers a good service and is kind to all he meets.

Roberto is very grateful for this opportunity, and hopes to use the support from this loan to purchase a set of tires and speakers for his taxi. By sprucing up his car, he hopes that he will be able to offer a higher quality service to his customers, and will therefore increase his income. His goal is to buy another car in the future, and to work toward his dream of owning a large taxi business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and speakers for his car.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, who is a mother of four children with the last born still schooling, has been an active farmer, meeting her family needs from farming income generated through sale of her cereals and milk produce to the local market.

Mary has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a power generator which will help her with pumping water for her dairy animals and  save her hours engaged in fetching water. She adds the constant supply of water will also open up her business by allowing for growing vegetables.

She is optimistic her business can provide enough income to pay for the education of her last child.

loans.use: To buy a power generator

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a mother of five children, three of whom are still school-going. She has been in farming for over thirty years producing maize, beans, bananas, coffee and milk, part of which go into meeting family requirements with more sold within the local market to provide more income.

Lucy has made a loan request of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This is her third loan with Juhudi Kilimo and she reiterates that the loans have improved her family living standards and educated her first three children. She is looking forward to better education for her remaining children.

She however notes the high cost of feed especially for dairy cows during dry seasons is still a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ayder Luis

texts.es: El señor Ayder, es comerciante de cal empacada, actividad comercial que tiene desde hace dos años, su capital inicial fue de ahorros propios del cliente y ayuda económica de su madre, anteriormente él era conductor, su negocio consiste en vender cal empacada en el occidente de Nicaragua a productores de ganado, ferreterías y distribuidoras de la zona. También tiene clientes de una sola entrega, que posteriormente estas personas revenden el producto en zonas mas lejanas de nuestro país.
texts.en:
Ayder has been selling packaged lime powder for two years.  His initial capital came from his own savings and his mother’s financial help.  He was previously a driver.

His business consists of selling packaged lime powder in the western part of Nicaragua.  He sells to livestock producers, hardware shops, and distributors in the area.  He also has customers who receive one delivery and later resell the product in areas further away in our country.

loans.use: to buy lime powder in bulk.

loans.name: Phidis

texts.en:
Phidis is married with five, all adult, children in her rural home in Kenya. She says farming has been her source of income for the nineteen years she has been actively farming. Her farm has been producing vegetables, maize, beans and milk which she sells within the local market for income to meet other family needs as well as expand her farming business.

Phidis has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water pump and water pipes to establish an irrigation system. She says her previous loan of the same amount really helped improve the living standards of her family and she hopes this subsequent loan will make things better still.

Phidis says harsh climatic conditions are a major limitation in her farming yield but installing an irrigation system will definitely improve the situation.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Sinsiria

texts.en:
Sinsiria has been in farming in Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya where she lives with her family of five children. She is aged 52 with half of her life having been spent in farming as the main source of family income. She runs her farm with the help of three farmhands. She is married with five children aged between 16 and 7 years. She now sells her produce which includes coffee, milk, tea, cabbages and sweet potatoes.

Sinsiria has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to spend in setting up a modern dairy unit for her dairy cows. She plans to have at least five dairy cows.She says the farming income will assure her children of better education and future. She reiterates that her aspiration is to provide good housing and education, among other basic needs, to her children.

Sinsiria says the major challenge mainly occurs during high harvests when a lot is produced and sold to the market at very low prices with low returns to farmers' investments.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Priska

texts.en:
Priska has been in active farming for over 20 years.  She currently produces coffee, milk, maize, and beans for the local market in her home area in Nyamira in South Rift Kenya. She runs her farm with the help of two farmhands.

Priska is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy two water tanks which will help her supply water for her dairy cows. She will also use the loan to venture into farming vegetables. She says that better production of vegetables and other grocery products will boost her grocery retail business which she has been carrying out concurrently with farming. She hopes to expand her grocery business to the wholesale scale in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchse two water tanks.

loans.name: Ercilda Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ercilda, es comerciante de cal empacada, actividad comercial que tiene desde hace 10 años, su negocio lo inicio con créditos otorgado por productores de cal de la zona de san Rafael del sur y posteriormente con pequeños créditos de algunas microfinancieras, anteriormente ella vendía gaseosas y vendía carne de cerdo, su negocio consiste en vender cal empacada en el norte de Nicaragua a productores de ganado, ferreterías y distribuidoras de la zona. El crédito que solicito con ceprodel fue para capital de trabajo con lo que se proyecta en mejorar sus niveles de ingresos sobre sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ercilda has a business selling lime in bulk. She has been engaged in this activity for the past 10 years.  She started the business using loans that were provided by lime producers in the southern area of San Rafael.  Later she made use of small loans from various microfinance institutions and also sold soft drinks and pork.

Currently she sells bulk lime in the northern part of Nicaragua to livestock farmers, hardware stores and distributors in the area.  The loan she is seeking through CEPRODEL is for working capital so that she can improve her sales and her income.

loans.use: to purchase lime in bulk.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La señora Trinidad se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de un producto típico del estado de Veracruz, aquí lo conocemos como obleas este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para su familia, ya que tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para invertir en comprar materia prima  y herramientas que es una parilla más grandes y unos sartenes especiales, para la elaboración de las galletas.
Desea invertir en el negocio, porque le están ofreciendo vender sus productos a restaurantes y para fiestas infantiles. Y así podrá ayudar a otras personas dándoles trabajo.
texts.en:
Trinidad works making and selling a product that’s typical of the State of Veracruz known as “obleas” [a type of thin wafer].  This business is her family’s source of income since she has three children she’s responsible for.

She’s asking for the loan to buy raw materials and tools which are larger griddles and special pans to make the wafers.

She wants to invest in the business because she’s being given the opportunity to sell her products to restaurants and for children’s parties and she’ll be able to provide jobs for other people this way.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and equipment to make wafers.

loans.name: Mirian Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Mirian es Originaria de un poblado del departamento de león, se  desempeña como conserje de un instituto de la misma población con 24 años  de laborar, además también tiene un pequeño negocio atravez de ahorro de su salario, el que tiene 11 años de ejercerlo como es la venta de Ropa , Calzados, Pintura, Vanidad, perfume y Ropa Interior. esto en busca como tener otros ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, su unidad familiar está compuesta por  2 hijos de los cuales 1 está bajo su cargo y estudia en el colegio de la localidad, también ha sido cliente de esta empresa desde el 2004, con 6 créditos recibidos, una de las necesidades que presenta es de comprar más productos  para incrementar su inventario de su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda existente, por tal razón decidió visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y lograr el objetivo, los financiamientos anteriores les han sido de gran impactos en la mejoría de sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mariana is from a town in the department of León.  She’s been working as a caretaker at a local institution for 24 years.  She also has a small business she started with savings from her salary that’s been in operation for 11 years.  She sells clothes, shoes, paint, make-up, perfume and underwear.  She does this in order to earn extra income and improve her conditions and her standard of living.

Her family unit contains her two children one of whom is still in her care and attending the local school.  She’s been a client of this institution since 2004 and has gotten six loans.  

One of her current needs is to buy more products to increase her business inventory to meet existing demand which is why she decided to visit the Ceprodel offices to request financing to reach this goal.  Previous loans had a great impact in improving her conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Andrés

texts.es: El señor francisco, es propietario de una pulpería ubicado en la comunidad de san pablo, tiene dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, estableció su negocio gracias al apoyo económico de sus padres, el es ingeniero en sistemas y ha decidido en trabajar por cuenta propia por la falta de oportunidad de empleo en nuestro país, sin embargo tiene un alto espíritu de supera ración y cree que este crédito le abrirá la oportunidad de seguir obteniendo financiamientos para desarrollar su actividad comercial y llevarlo a otro nivel.
texts.en: Francisco owns a grocery store located in the community of San Pablo.  He’s been in business two years.  He opened the store thanks to economic support from his parents.  He is a computer programmer but has decided to work for himself due to the lack of employment opportunities in our country.  Nevertheless, he has a strong spirit of self-improvement and he believes that this loan will open the opportunity to continue obtaining loans to develop his commercial activity taking it to another level.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Mario Donaldo

texts.es: El señor Mario, es propietario de un taller de carpintería en la comunidad de los Gutiérrez norte, tiene tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad, antes de tener su taller él era vendedor de muebles y espejos decorados patas de león, y gracias al conocimiento y a la habilidad que adquirió, decidió en invertir para comprar sus propias herramientas y establecer su propio negocio, el aprendió el oficio de la carpintería desde muy joven, lo que le permitió llegar a tener su propio local de trabajo y desarrollarse de forma independiente.
texts.en: Mario owns a carpentry shop in the community of Gutiérrez Norte.  He’s been in this line of work for three years.  Prior to having his workshop he worked selling furniture and mirrors decorated in Lion’s Paw style and thanks to the skills obtained decided to buy his own tools and open his own business.  He learned carpentry when still very young which made it possible for him to have his own place of work and to develop independently.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Mary Lourdes

texts.en:
Mary Lourdes is 41 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Mary Lourdes catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to  purchase gasoline, hooks, nets and other fishing materials. Mary Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Mary Lourdes hopes to save more for her family.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline, hooks, nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Merilou

texts.en:
Merilou is 32 years old and lives in Southern Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Merilou has a general store and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase assorted groceries like noodles, cooking oil, and shampoo.
 
Merilou has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Merilou hopes to increase her income to cover the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries like noodles, cooking oil, and shampoo for resale.

loans.name: Jonathan Ismael

texts.es:
El trabajo de educación requiere de mucho sacrificio y seguimiento en la enseñanza aprendizaje, Consciente de esto,  El señor Jonathan  se dedica a laborar como maestro de Secundaria  un colegio técnico del departamento de león,  atendiendo a jóvenes  de varias edades en el colegio donde dignamente imparte el pan de la enseñanza,  y cuya preocupación principal es la educación en estas personas ya que son el futuro de la nación y el mejoramiento de los niveles de vida.
El acude a Ceprodel porque requiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una Computadora la cual le ayudara a agilizar sus actividades como maestro y también en sus estudios universitarios ya que el desarrollo tecnológico permite la utilización de las mismas,  Esto con el fin de garantizar un desarrollo más avanzado de sus clases, la inversión le vendría a garantizar el nivel de Desarrollo y por ende la enseñanza misma, ya que también viene a mejorar su nivel de vida que tanto lo requiere para beneficio propio y familiar.
texts.en:
Work in education requires much sacrifice and follow-through in teaching/learning.  Aware of this, Jonathan works as a secondary school teacher at a technical school in León Department teaching youngsters of various ages in the school where he imparts knowledge with dignity.  His main concern is educating these people since they are the future of the nation and to improve standards of living.

He calls on Ceprodel because he wants to request a loan to buy a computer that will help him streamline his teaching duties and also to use in his university courses since technological development allows their use.  This is with the goal in mind of insuring a more advanced development in his classes.  The investment would guarantee his level of development thus his actual learning since he will also be improving his standard of living which he so needs both for his own and his family’s benefit.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Brando Angel

texts.es:
Brando es un hombre de 24 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su amada pareja y sus 2 pequeños hijos; Brando es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos familiares no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus pequeños y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su pareja, desde varios años Brando trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, él cuenta con su propio vehículo el cual adquirió con mucho esfuerzo con ahorros de trabajos anteriores, Brando trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y puede atender un promedio de 40 clientes, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su trato amable y respetuoso.
Brando se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar  el mantenimiento y refacción de su vehículo, ya que requiere arreglar el motor de su mototaxi, el cual está consumiendo mucha gasolina; de esta manera Brando contará con un vehículo en buenas condiciones y así brindará un mejor servicio e incrementará sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales mas adelante desea adquirir un auto brindar servicios de taxi y trabajar en él y con ello desea poder cumplir su gran sueño de poder asegurar el futuro y bienestar de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Brando is a 24-year-old man. He lives in the town of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with his beloved partner and their two small children. Brando is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who devotes all his efforts to getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, due to his need to work and pay for his family's expenses, he couldn't pursue a professional career, but he would have liked to have studied for a career in business administration. In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer with his little ones and sometimes he cooks a delicious "arroz con pollo" (chicken and rice) that he shares with his family.
On his own initiative and thanks to the support he gets from his partner, Brando has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver for many years. He has a vehicle of his own, which he purchased with a lot of effort by saving money from previous jobs. Brando works approximately 10 hours a day and he's able to serve an average of 40 customers. He feels comfortable in his work and believes that his business does well because of his friendly, respectful manners.
Brando is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he'll be able to do maintenance and renovations on his vehicle. He needs to fix the engine in his motorcycle taxi, since it consumes a lot of gasoline. That way Brando will have a vehicle in good condition and provide a better service. He'll increase his profits, which later on he'll use to purchase a car in order to work with it in providing taxi services. By doing that he wishes to achieve his biggest dream of being able to ensure his little children's future and well-being.

loans.use: to do maintenance and renovations on his vehicle.

loans.name: Jesus Angel

texts.es:
Jesús es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y quienes ya están estudiando la universidad.
Jesús tiene su negocio de venta de ropa usada a fuera de su vivienda quien lo atiende es el y su esposa la señora Rebeca quien le ayudad cuando el tiene que ir a trabajar en la compañía de seguridad publica y se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos. Desea mejorar el negocio y tener mas variedad de productos y de mejor calidad ya que sus clientes le están solicitando este tipo de mercancía y así sus ganancias serán mejor.
texts.en:
Jesus is a family man with two children under his responsibility who are already studying in college.

Jesus has a business selling used clothing outside of his home which he tends to.  His wife Rebecca helps him when he has to go to work in the company of public safety and takes responsibility for caring for their children. Jesus wants to improve the business and have more variety and better quality products because his customers are asking for this type of merchandise, and thus he will have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy goods for his used clothing business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de león, originario de una comarca aledaña  El señor Julio es Felizmente  Casado, de profesión Productor Agropecuario actividad que ejerce desde sus ancestros quienes lo enseñaron a trabajar de esa manera,  tiene 47 años de realizar dicha actividad, legado que le ha dejado a sus hijos con los que han ido trabajando a la par de él y hoy algunos ya son independientes.
Desde que inicio su negocio El señor Julio lo que es la Agricultura en pequeñas areas  se esforzó por mejorar y emprender otra actividad como es la Crianza de Ganado tanto de leche como para el trabajo agrícola, siendo las ambas de gran fortaleza económica tradicional desde sus padres y de esa manera mantener su familia la que es independiente por su propia cuenta y hoy vivir la vejez de manera satisfactoria y realizada con sus hijos formados con sus familias propias, además tiene un area de bosques las que tiene de manera  organizada una de la necesidad es la compra de un toro semental para seguir completando la actividad pecuaria..
texts.en: Julio is originally from a neighboring region of the town of Telica, in León department.  He is happily married and a farmer.  He learned the business from his ancestors and has been in this line of work for 47 years.  Julio has, in turn, taught the business to his own children who have worked alongside him.  Some of his children are now independent.  Julio has worked hard to improve his farming business and also start another business, raising cattle, both for producing milk and for farm work.  Both of his businesses have traditionally been of great financial help since his parents' time.  Julio has been able to support his family through his businesses and now he can live a decent old age as his children have formed their own families.  Julio also owns an area of woodland.  One of his needs is to buy a stud bull so that he can continue working in his agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to buy a stud bull

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catálogos, este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para salir adelante, ya que vive sola.
Desea invertir en comprar más mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes para entregar y no quiere que sus clientas  no la quieran esperar a que les surta sus productos de belleza y ya no le compren. Este tipo de negocio abunda en la ciudad ya que deja buenos ingresos y es una forma de conocer gente y socializar de muy buena forma. Como nosotros apoyamos a este tipo de personas emprendedoras le brindamos ala oportunidad de seguir dando pasos hacia adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa sells beauty products via catalogues; this business is her source of income to get ahead since she lives alone.  She wants to buy more merchandise since she has several pending orders to fill and she does not want her customers to have to wait until she stocks up with products lest they stop buying from her.  

This type of business is rife in the city since it produces good income and it’s a way of getting to know people and socialize in a healthy way.  Because we at Ceprodel support this type of enterprising person we provide the opportunity for her to continue taking steps forward.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and pay her suppliers.

loans.name: Ramiro De Jesús

texts.es:
Ramiro de Jesús, inicia a ofertar su producto desde las 3:00 am, su mayor demanda son clientes que compran al por mayor y al detalle, cierra su negocio hasta las 7:00 pm según su movimiento y está ubicado en uno de los mercado de la ciudad de León. El señor realiza este tipo de trabajo para el sustento de su familia.


 El señor solicita este crédito que será utilizarlo para la compra de cosechas de plátanos al por mayor.

 Ramiro se siente muy conforme con el crédito que le ha brindado CEPRODEL ya que le ha permitido comprar cosechas de plátano de mejor calidad y mejorar su propia producción.
texts.en:
Ramiro de Jesús starts to sell his product at 3am.  Most of his demand comes from customers who buy at wholesale and retail.  He closes at 7pm according to how much movement there is.  He’s located in one of the markets in the city of León.  He does this type of work in order to support his family. 

He’s asking for this loan to buy entire banana harvests at wholesale.  Ramiro feels very happy with the loan Ceprodel has granted him because it’s made it possible for him to buy better quality bananas and to improve his own production.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Palerma

texts.en:
Palerma is married with four children. She is 62 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Palerma has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,500. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase feed and piglets. 

Palerma has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Palerma hopes to own a piggery someday.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is married with five children. She is 54 years old and lives in Victoria, Oroquieta City.

Emelia sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

Emelia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Emelia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with four children. She is 30 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental.

Juliet sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

Juliet has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Juliet hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: To purchase flour, milk, sugar, and cooking oil for food production.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is married with two children. She lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Perlita sells perfumes to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to  purchase perfumes for her business.

Perlita has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Perlita hopes to engage in another business.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felicidad es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras, venta de calzados, venta de plásticos, tienda de abarrotes, costura de deportivos.

La señora Felicidad, indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia desde hace tiempo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de prendas de vestir ella cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió  por referentes de una amiga, que anteriormente había realizado este emprendimiento.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de prendas de vestir) mismo que comprará de las ferias reconocidas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo venderá de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo) en la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS” (Entrepreneurial Women) community bank are about to start their seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  This group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which has Felicidad as its treasurer.  The businesses that the members of the group are engaged in vary and include: running a neighborhood store, selling cosmetics, selling vegetables, selling shoes, selling plastic products, running a grocery store and sewing sports clothing.

Felicidad says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, having joined through an invitation from a friend who has been a member for some time.  Felicidad currently has a business selling clothing.  She says that she started this business on the suggestion of a friend who used to be in the same line of work.

Felicidad will use this loan to increase her capital.  She will buy clothing in the well-known street markets in the city of La Paz and then sell them as an itinerant street vendor (without a fixed sales location) in the city of El Alto.  This work allows her to make income to support her family.  She is a widow and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Felicidad replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Manishak

texts.en:
Manishak is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm, where she grows a large variety of vegetables (potatoes, beans, onions, carrots and garlic), barley, wheat and also grows many fruit trees. Manishak's husband helps her with daily agricultural activities. Manishak has applied for this loan to start the land cultivation. In particular she plans to purchase 750 kg of barley seeds, 1200 kg of potato seeds, fuel and 25 bags of fertilzier. The fuel and fertilizer will be uses not only for barley and potato cultivation, but also for autumn sowing, when she will cultivate the wheat. 

Manishak lives with her husband and school-age daughter. Her two elder daughters are married and live apart. Manishak's elder son has left to go abroad to work and support the family, and her younger son serves in the army at present. Manishak wishes to cultivate more land and start raising cattle, too. This is important her for to have enough income, so that her son will come back and get involved in agriculture, too. Manishak greatly evaluates the role of this loan for realization of her purpose.

loans.use: to pay for barley and potato seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Cielito Tatiana

texts.es: La Sra. Cielito tiene 22 años, tiene su pareja, ella se dedica al servicio de manicurista y también maquillaje en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la zona España, de la ciudad de Santa Cruz este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Cielito va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de material como esmaltes de uñas y secador de esmaltes por mayor y algunos materiales que necesita y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que necesita ampliar su negocio, la Sra. Cielito  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo, el deseo de la Sra. Cielito es tener un salon de estetica  mas completo donde ofrezca variedad de servicios de arreglo corporal a su clientela.
texts.en:
Cielito is 22, has a partner, and works as a manicurist and makeup artist in her salon that is located in the neighborhood España, in the city of Santa Cruz.  This loan is her first cycle in the institution.  

Cielito will use this loan to purchase materials such as nail polish and polish dryer wholesale and some materials she needs and thus increase her working capital.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she needs to expand her business.  Cielito faces challenges in her business such as having greater market coverage and will use the profits to continue to purchase materials and improve her work.  Cielito's desire is to have a more esthetic salon which offers a full range of body services to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as nail polish and polish dryer wholesale.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is involved in agriculturue. She runs a farm, where she grows a large variety of fruits and vegetables. She keeps two green houses, where she grows peppers. Ruzanna also cultivates tomatoes and beans, and grows apricot, peach, and plum trees. It is very difficult for Ruzanna to organize the watering process of the land, as there is no special place to gather and keep much water. So Ruzanna has to water the land with a pail, which requires much time and hard work. 

Ruzanna has applied for this loan to build a hole to gather and keep water. This will make the watering process much easier and effective for Ruzanna. With the loan's help Ruzanna also plans to purchase fertilizer and medicine to exploit the land and cultivate the trees. 

Ruzanna lives with her father and daughter. Agriculture is the main source of income for her family. This loan will help Ruzanna to develop her farm and have a stable source of income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, medicine, and for construction of a hole for water storage

loans.name: Yeshua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YESHUA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Guillermina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de peluches, tejedora de chompas, confección y venta de mandiles, cerrajería, tienda de barrio, costura, venta de rellenos y sopa de fideo, ladrillera.

La señora Guillermina, indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ladrillos, ella cuenta que empezó este negocio después de haber trabajado varios años en una fábrica de ladrillos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de ladrillos) mismo que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo) ofreciendo a los dueños que están edificando sus construcciones. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es separada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “Yeshua” communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Guillermina, the President.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of commercial activities among which we have the sale of stuffed toys, sweater knitting, apron making and selling, metal shop services, neighborhood store, sewing, sale of turnovers and noodle soup and brick making.

Guillermina indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for four years having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who’s a member of the institution.  She currently has a brick-making business.  She relates that she started the business after having worked in a brick factory for several years.

The loan she’s asking for now is to expand her merchandise.  She will buy bricks from suppliers in the city of El Alto and then will resell them from place to place (she has no permanent stand).  She sells to owners of building sites.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible since she’s separated and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy bricks.

loans.name: Denis De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Don Denis sigue con su venta de persiana de vidrio, muy demandada por ser bonitas, atreves de los préstamo logro mejor demanda al vender más producto.
Las mejoras a su casa la ah venido haciendo con préstamo otorgados en Afodenic, lo que le ha resultado por ser a plazos, equilibrando sus gastos, aun dos de sus hijos viven con él. Con este nuevo préstamo, va a mejor su techo, ya que esta en malas condiciones por el uso de los años, pasándosele el agua, en esta temporada de invierno. Comprara láminas de zinc y pintura anticorrosiva, para hacer el cambio. Para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Denis continues selling glass blinds which are very much in demand because they are beautiful.  Through his previous loans, he has managed to sell more and increase demand for his products.

Denis has been making improvements to his home through loans from Afodenic because he is able to repay in installments and so balance his expenses.  Two of his children still live with him.  Denis will use this new loan to improve his roof because it has deteriorated over the years and water is seeping in during the winter.  He will buy sheets of metal and anti-corrosive paint to make the improvement.  This will contribute to his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and anti-corrosive paint in order to improve his roof

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm, where she keeps a cow, pigs, hens and turkeys, and also cultivates melons, watermelon, apricots, peaches, granatees, walnut trees and a grape orchard. Mariam has applied for this loan to purchase forage for cow and pigs. She also plans to purchase medicine and fertilizer to exploit the land, as well as poles for growing grape trees. Mariam will also purchase fuel to transport her harvest. This loan will greatly help Mariam with the farm and help her to ensure it can develop. 

Mariam lives with her husband, son and three daughters, two of whom are not grown-up yet. Agriculture is important for the family to generate income and make savings to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage, medicine, fertilizer, fuel and poles.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is married with two children.  She is 64 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Remedios sells variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients.

Remedios has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Remedios hopes to have more savings for capital.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, milk, and other snack ingredients.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 41 years old and lives in Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with two children.  

Marlyn has a sari sari store that sells assorted canned goods and other groceries.  She has had this business for one year.  She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase assorted canned goods and other grocery items for the store. 

Marlyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative since last month.  Marlyn hopes and dreams that her business will succeed and grow up fast.

loans.use: To purchase assorted canned goods and other items for her grocery.

loans.name: Azniv

texts.en:
Azniv is involved in agriculture. Together with her family, she runs a farm, where they raise livestock and cultivate land. Azniv cultivates wheat. She also runs an orchard, where she grows apricot, peach, grape, and grenade fruit trees. Azniv also has a barn, where she bred pigs a few years ago, but had to sell them. Now Azniv would like to start pig breeding again, so she has applied for this loan to purchase young pigs. Azniv also plans to purchase chickens and forage to feed the livestock. 

Azniv lives with her husband, son and daughter. She works at the local school as a teacher, but her salary is too low to cover the family's costs, and they get the main part of their income from selling the harvest from the farm to local traders. The development of her agriculture business will allow Azniv to get more income and insure more prosperous living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for young pigs, chickens, and feed

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 52 years old and lives in Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 10 years, Lolita has worked in the fish industry, selling fish for a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase boxes of assorted fish. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of assorted fish

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es: Jesús  de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas,  el originario de Estelí es cliente Kiva, su segundo préstamo fue de gran ayuda porque pudo invertir en su siembra obteniendo mejor rendimiento y calidad en sus productos, incrementaron sus ventas generando a la vez mas ingresos para la familia. Utilizo su segundo préstamo para comprar insumos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar pepino, pero el quiere invertir aun mas en su negocio ya que la demanda de su productos a incrementado es por esta razón que hoy en día solicita de su tercer crédito Kiva al igual para comprar insumos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar tomate, el estima este préstamo será de ayuda ya que podrá mantener su negocio activo y podrá ofrecer a sus clientes un producto de buena calidad además obtendrá buenos rendimientos de su cosecha, venderá a un buen precio para generar mas ganancias que reinvertirá luego en su negocio, su siguiente paso es ampliar su parcela y diversificarse en productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes con el objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos y  poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Jesús is a farmer by trade; he grows vegetables. This Estelí native is a Kiva borrower and his second loan was of great help, because he was able to invest in his crop. He obtained improved productivity and quality in his crop, which increased his sales and, in turn, resulted in more income for the family. He used his second loan to purchase supplies and pay for labor in order to sow cucumber. However, he wants to invest in his business even more, since demand for his produce has increased. That's the reason why he currently requests his third Kiva loan, also to purchase supplies and pay for labor, so that he can sow tomatoes. He believes that this loan will be of help, because he'll be able to keep his business going and offer his customers high quality goods. Besides, he'll get good productivity in his harvest, and he'll sell it at good prices in order to get more profits that will soon be re-invested in his business. His next step is to expand his plot of land and diversify his produce so he can satisfy his customers' needs. His goal is to obtain higher profits and to be able to get himself and his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and pay for labor in order to sow tomatoes.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y su pequeño hijo de 3 añitos; Karen es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su pequeño; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres, desde hace 2 años Karen puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de paltas, ella realiza sus ventas en el mercado de frutas de su ciudad, en algunas ocasiones adicionalmente vende diversas frutas; ella se encuentra muy a gusto realizando su labor, ya que desde niña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor.
Karen se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de frutas para su venta, especialmente compra gran cantidad de manzanas ya que se acerca la campaña para poder venderlas; de esta manera Karen podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales espera poder expandir su negocio y contar con un local más amplio, y así en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder tener su casa propia y cumplir su gran sueño de asegurar el futuro y bienestar de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Karen, 25, lives in the city of Cañete in Imperial District with her parents and little 3-year-old son.  Karen is a very cheerful, hardworking, enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into raising her son.  Unfortunately, because she had to go to work to cover her expenses she was unable to study a professional career but would very much have liked to do so.

Thanks to her parents’ support Karen started her business selling avocadoes two years ago in her city’s fruit market.  On occasion she also sells other various fruits.  She’s very happy doing her work because her parents taught her this occupation when she was still a little girl.

Karen is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy fruit to sell, especially large amounts of apples since their sale season is approaching.  In this way Karen will be able to increase sales and income that she hopes to use to expand the business and to have a larger locale so that in the not too distant future she will be able to have her own house and reach her great dream of insuring her little boy’s future and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Angoritas De Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGORITAS DE INGENIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de chocolate, tejido de mantas, venta de aceite, venta de zapatos.

La señora Rosa, indica que hace año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio elaboración y venta de mantas, ella cuenta que realiza los tejidos desde hace años atrás, aprendiendo estos tejidos de un grupo de señoras que emprendieron este negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de lana) mismo que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo) en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Angoritas de Ingenio” (The Clever Little Goats) will start the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Rosa who is the President.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of commercial activities among which we have clothes sales, chocolates sales, blanket weaving, oil sales and shoe sales.

Rosa indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for a year and a half having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s advisors.  She currently has a blanket weaving business.  She relates that she started weaving blankets years ago having learned to weave from a group of women who went into this business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her merchandise.  She will buy wool from suppliers in the city of El Alto that she’ll use to make blankets that she’ll subsequently sell from place to place (she has no permanent stand) in various street markets in the city of El Alto.  This way of working makes it possible for her to support her family the best she can since she’s married and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
This is Diosdado, who previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand his inventory. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. 

Diosdado would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy a motorcycle and to buy more stocks of products needed in his business. The more items displayed at the store, the better, and more items to sell will result in better profit. Diosdado's business profits will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and his business expenditures. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Diosdado faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in his business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Rosita is selling copra, the dried meat of coconuts, in her local community. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more coconuts for making copra.

Rosita is a new member of HSPF.  In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for making copra.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 45 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Charita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Charita has been farming sugarcane for two years, and she earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Isidra provides motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 3 years. Isidra has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy tools and to pay for gasoline. Isidra has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her services for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for gasoline

loans.name: Danilsa Kariela

texts.es: Danilsa, tiene una pulpería desde hace ocho años, inicio su negocio vendiendo chiverías y caramelos, y durante todo este tiempo de arduo trabajo y perseverancia a logrado crecer como persona y en su actividad económica, actualmente cuenta con un local donde ofrece a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos como granos básicos, ropa, cosméticos, gaseosas, entre otros. Es el primer crédito con ceprodel, sin embargo logre observar en ella un gran entusiasmo de trabajar y desarrollar aun mas su negocio
texts.en: Danilsa has owned a grocery store for the past eight years. She started her business by selling snacks and candy, and during all this time of hard work and perseverance she succeeded in growing both as a person and in her business. She currently owns a store where she offers her customers a wide variety of merchandise such as basic grains, clothing, cosmetics and soft drinks, among other items. This is her first loan with Ceprodel, and nevertheless she displays a great deal of enthusiasm to work and further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 51 years old and married, with four children.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her general store.

Emelia has borrowed, and repaid, five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Emelia aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es una mujer de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, se encuentra felizmente casada con su amado esposo quien es maestro de obras de construcción, tiene 3 hijos a quienes ama y desea brindarles lo mejor; Ysabel siempre ha sido una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos conjuntamente con su esposo para sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros y programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace varios años Ysabel puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y puede atender a un promedio de 30 clientes, Ysabel se siente a gusto realizando su trabajo y cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la buscan por sus productos, precios y buena atención.
Ysabel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que necesita realizar refacciones a los cuartos de sus hijos, tales como el encofrado, tarrajeo, puesta de piso y otros; de esta manera Ysabel tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones brindando un ambiente más seguro; así ella espera poder seguir trabajando y luchando para asegurar el bienestar y futuro de sus hijos, a quienes desea poder brindarles una profesión para que sean hombres de bien y buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a woman of 47, who lives in the city of Chincha.  She is happily married to her beloved husband who teaches construction, and has 3 children whom she loves and wants to give the best. Ysabel has always been a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. She has devoted all her effort together with her husband to raise her family.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of funds she could not pursue a professional career, but she would have liked to do so.  In her spare time she likes to watch the news and educational programs on television and sometimes she cooks a delicious rice dish with duck to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with support from her family for several years, Ysabel launched a small business selling groceries.  Her work starts in the early morning, she works in her business an estimated 12 hours a day and can serve an average of 30 customers.  Ysabel enjoys doing her job and believes in serving her customers well as they seek her products, pricing and good service.

Ysabel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to their assistance she will be able to improve her home.  She needs spare parts for the children's bedrooms, such as formwork, plaster, flooring etc.  This way Ysabel will have a home in better condition and be better able to provide a safer environment. She hopes to continue working and fighting to ensure the welfare and future of their children.  She wants to be able to give them a profession so that they will grow up to be good people and successful professionals.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Noeurb

texts.en:
A villager from Ek Phnom District of Battambang Province, Noeurb is a mother of three kids who still need her support as they are still in school. 

She is now 32 years old, and she has been selling fish for five years to overcome her family's hardship. Her husband has also been trying to help her via raising fish and rice farming. The main difficulty for her family is the high price of rice seed and the crop yield ruined by flood. 

Noeurb has borrowed from VisionFund four times already. The loans, which have all been successfully repaid, have  enabled her to well-manage the cash flow of her family's businesses, rice farming and fish raising. 

Now, she is confident, as a fifth-cycle client, in applying for a new loan with VisionFund in amount of KHR 2,000,000.  She will use the money not only to support her rice farm by buying fertilizers and hiring a laborer for plowing but also to support her fish raising business by purchasing fish feed and more fingerlings for breeding. 

She hopes the loan will gradually improve her businesses, as the past loans have, so she can keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizers, fish feed, and fingerlings for breeding and to hire a laborer for plowing.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 64 years old and has eight children. She is married and has one child currently going to school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pig.

Evangeline has been fattening pigs for ten years now, and she has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her pig

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with five children. 

Roberto provides motorcycle services. He has had this business for seven years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his transportation services.

Roberto has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Roberto hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his motorcycle services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more textiles for making gowns and school uniforms

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is married with 2 children. She is 44 years old and lives in Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.
Josefa sells a variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 9 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.
Josefa has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Josefa hopes to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase flour, milk, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en: Analisa  is  45  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Analisa has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Analisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Analisa hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Kim Leng

texts.en: Kim Lang is 63 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is an art instructor. In addition, she runs a groceries store at home. She earns approximately $12 each day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $1 per day. Two of her children are dancers. They make the income of $8 daily. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Kim Leng is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the family’s transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
This is Edwin.  He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used in buying more quantities of products like rice, chicken, eggs, condiments and seasonings for his food stall. His earnings are a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Edwin would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for him to purchase more ingredients and supplies needed in his business. His profits from the business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and the educational expenses for his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Edwin hopes to grow his business in the coming years, just as he hopes to support his children's schooling up to the college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for his food stall

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 64 years old, widowed and lives in the Philippines. 

Grace sells cakes for different occasions. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making cakes for different occasions like flour, sugar and eggs .

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2006.  In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: by ingredients to make cakes to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
