Ramón is requesting a loan because he needs to further invest in his business.  He will buy a variety of clothing to go out and sell.  He will also buy cheese which will be a way of increasing his business.

Ramón's experience in his business allows him to work with loans.  His previous loan allowed him to repair his motorcycle, which helped him to serve a larger number of customers.  This improved his income.  He plans to continue growing his business and gradually improving his family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cheese

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for 16 years.  

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes. She works six days a week and sells to all categories of people but on retail. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to see her business grow into a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house.

She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees, transport and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic, a net and a drip irrigation system

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 29-year-old married man from Ibb, Yemen. He has two children. He is an employer in Municipal Corporation. He works hard to provide for his family's needs and to send his children to school.

He has requested a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase a motorcycle. He hopes for this loan to help improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle for transporting people

loans.name: Basam

texts.en:
Basam is a 22-year-old single man who has run an Internet café for one year. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. He offers Internet access and phone accessories to his customers, who are mostly teenagers. Over the years, he has succeeded in building a respectful reputation for his place, whilst maintaining quality service and competitive prices. 

He is always keen on developing and expanding his business. He has already saved some money, and he is applying for a Youth Loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to get the rest of what he needs. He will use the loan to buy new computers.

loans.use: to buy new computers for his business

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya, 28, is married man with two children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He’s taken on the role of head of family.

Yahya is a soldier. He’s responsible, which is why he’s been able to move his family forward. He has a house and he’s asking for a youth loan of YER 200,000 from AMB to buy wood for his house. With this he will be able to offer better security for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood for his house

loans.name: Faiz

texts.en:
Faiz is 38 years old and is married with four children. He lives in IBB, Yemen. He is a teacher.

He has requested a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a new motorcycle to help him to transport people. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to help him transport people

loans.name: Nila Esther

texts.es: Nila de 43 años de edad compró calzado, ropa perfumería, cosméticos al por mayor y ganó descuentos que trasladó en precio a sus clientes. Ahora necesita un fondo de efectivo nuevamente para atender a una clientela que reactivó, pues de ella tiene encargos de ropa femenina, calzado y accesorios femeninos y eso lo logrará si acude a un nuevo credikiva para comprarlo nuevamente a un precio especial. Su mensaje a los financiadores es que está muy agradecida con Kiva y la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y quiere seguir contando con ese apoyo financiero para continuar prosperando con su negocio y en su familia.
texts.en:
Nila, 43, bought shoes, clothes, perfume and cosmetics at wholesale qualifying for discounts that she passed on to her customers.  Now she needs cash again to take care of customers she’s reactivated since she has pending orders for women’s clothes, shoes and women’s accessories and she will be able to do so if she has access to a new Kiva loan to buy it again at a special price.

Her message to lenders is that she’s very grateful to Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and that she wants to continue to rely on this financial support in order to continue making progress with her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and women's accessories.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder darle mantenimiento al negocio de productos medicinales, su intención es comprarse una variedad de productos omnilife y cuenta con una amplia gama de medicamentos para diferentes enfermedades, esta marca reconocida y le ha ayudado a atraer una gran porción de clientes.

Su experiencia con el credito anterior fue positiva, logrando mayor número de medicamentos y poder abarcar a un mejor número de clientes, él considera tener mejores ventas y de la misma manera mejores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan for his business selling medicinal products.  His intention is to buy a variety of Omnilife products so that he has a wide range of medicines for different illnesses.  This well-known brand has helped him to attract a large number of customers.

Juan's experience with his previous loan was positive.  He managed to buy more medicines and was able to gain more customers.  He hopes to achieve better sales and better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines

loans.name: Karla Raquel

texts.es:
Karla, necesita invertir en  su negocio, comprándose una variedad de blusas, falsas, ropa interior ropa para niños y también calzado para diferentes edades y con nuevos estilos, esto le permitirá darle un mejor funcionamiento el negocio abasteciendolos de nueva mercadería.

El efecto que ha tenido con préstamo anterior le ha permitido mejorar el inventario, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y mayor variedad, ha estado manteniendo su nivel de ventas, solamente ha tenido algunos problemas de salud en su esposo provocándole algunos impedimentos, pero hasta el momento se mantiene firme en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Karla needs to invest in her business buying a variety of blouses, skirts, underwear, children’s clothes and also shoes for different ages and in new styles.  This will allow her to give her business better efficiency stocking it with new merchandise.

The effect the previous loan had was to improve inventory in order to have a wider variety of better quality goods available for her customers.  She’s kept up her sales levels.  Only some health problems her husband had caused her some inconvenience but to date she continues firm in her work.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, solicita un nuevo préstamo debido a la necesidad de más capital para el negocio y una parte para su vivienda, se comprará pollo, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, y también comprará lamina y hierro para la instalación de un techo nuevo en su vivienda, esto le ayudará a solventar dos necesidades una en el negocio y otra en su casa.

Como el préstamo anterior logró mantener su negocio con una producción considerable de pupusas, ha podido ayudar a su familia y también está construyendo su propia vivienda, con la ganancia de este negocio ha logrado crecer y mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is requesting a new loan because she needs more capital for her business as well as for her home.  She will buy chicken, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), 'chicharrón' (ground, cooked pork) and oil.  She will also buy metal sheets and iron in order to install a new roof on her house.  This will help her to meet two needs: one related to her business and the other related to her home.

With her previous loan, Marta managed to maintain her business and produce a considerable number of pupusas.  She was able to help her family and is building her own home.  With the profits from her business, she has managed to grow her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, soft cheese, ground cooked pork and oil

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad, 27, is single and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He owns a grocery store that is very well known in the neighborhood. He started his business from his own savings, and then, thanks to his work and sacrifice, his grocery store grew and his business is now self-sufficient, sustained only by its own profits. He defines himself as a very hard-working person and someone who is very keen to get ahead and better himself.

Fuad is asking for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to stock his store with baked goods, canned foods, soft drinks and other items that generate the biggest profits. With these products, he will be able to meet demand as well as improve his income.

loans.use: to stock his store with items that generate the biggest profits.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has four children.

Lucia has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. Aside from that she also sells different kinds of viands (treats). She has had this business for nine years. 

She has requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Lucia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lumturie

texts.en:
Lumturie is in her sixties and has been widowed for a long time now. Her children are grownups. For the past four years she has been operating a little grocery store and the profit according to her has been okay. However, her daughter and son-in-law have been almost jobless for the past couple years, despite their efforts to find something in their field, and Lumturie considers herself responsible of helping them out financially. She says, "I'm helping them in addition to myself and most of all, I do all this, for my grandchildren. I want them to grow up healthy and get an education."

This is Lumturie's second loan, with the previous one being paid off. For now, she wants to repair the store and add some more shelves, and later on she would like to stock up on more inventory items. When she learned that the loan she is requesting is a Kiva loan, she could not hide her appreciation for the lenders. Lumturie is aware that she cannot do this without their support and she wants to thank them all in advance.

loans.use: To add some more shelves to the grocery store

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (brothers). 

She has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for seven years and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis at the market. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can start selling on a wholesale basis only and also build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major financial challenges include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Andres is selling snacks in his local community. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more snacks to resell like breads, juices, and banana.

Andres has been a member of HSPFI for since 2012. In the future, Andres hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snacks to resell

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed, 40, is a married man and has five children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen.

Three years ago Mohammed established a grocery store. He sells things like eggs, dairy products, soft drinks, flour, sugar, beans, and other grocery products. He has been able to increase his inventory and keep it stable.

Mohammed is currently requesting a loan for 100,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to stock various food products to offer his customers. His ambition is to grow the business so that his children can finish their education.

loans.use: to stock various food products to offer his customers.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es: Carmen tiene varios negocios, entre ellos hay uno  muy peculiar, que inició desde hace más de 10 años, donde ofrece  el servicio de armado de separadores de cajas de cartón, por el cual algunas empresas importantes, pagan la mano de obra, para que Carmen y su familia conformada por sus 7 hijos, realicen  la tarea y ganen dinero.  Así mismo se dedica a la venta de confitería, refrescos y bebidas los fines de semana y también al alquiler de lavadoras diariamente. En su ambiente familiar se respira el concepto de trabajo-negocio-ingresos y esa es la percepción que tiene cualquier persona que visita a esta mujer trabajadora de 60 años de edad, que aunque sin ninguna base de estudios, ha logrado como mujer viuda jefe de hogar sacar a sus hijos adelante y mantener ingresos constantes con los que ha logrado su bienestar. Carmen cuenta con un enfriador, un equipo de sonido para ambientar con música a quienes beben cerveza en un lugar de su casa que adecuó para tal fin. En todos sus negocios le ha ido muy bien porque la clientela es la misma y aprovechan  los clientes de un negocio,  para potencializar las ventas del otro. Últimamente dos de sus tres lavadoras han presentado fallas técnicas y necesita ajustarla y continuar prestando este servicio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domino, con el cual comprará 3 lavadoras y reparará las dos que requieren mantenimiento, su potencial de clientes, el buen manejo de su negocio y su destreza y capacidad de trabajo,  hará que   su credikiva sea una inversión de mucho éxito, que ayudará mucho a Carmen.
texts.en: Carmen runs various businesses, one of which is quite peculiar. She has been running a reinforced carton dividers business for more than 10 years, in which many important companies pay her for labor charges as Carmen and her family of 7 children carry out the work and earn money for doing so. She also runs a cafe selling soft and alcoholic drinks on the weekends, and she also hires out washing machines for a day at a time. Within her home, she lives and breathes the concept of 'work to earn' and that is the impression received by everybody who visits the home of this hardworking 60 year old woman. Although she has never studied much, as a widowed head of her household she has succeeded in helping her children to make good progress and in maintaining  a constant income to ensure their well-being. Carmen has a refrigerator and a music player to create a good atmosphere for those who come to drink beer at her home. All of her businesses are successful as she has the same customers for each, and she uses one business to promote her others. Recently, 2 of her 3 washing machines developed technical faults and she needs to repair them in order to continue offering this service. Consequently, she is applying for a loan - her first - from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will use to buy 3 washing machines and to repair the 2 requiring maintenance. Her strong client base, her effective management of her business, along with her skill and capacity for work means that this loan will be successfully invested and will be a real help to Carmen.

loans.use: to buy 3 washing machines and to repair 2 others which require maintenance.

loans.name: Rosas De Viacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE VIACHA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Blanca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de mantillas, venta de medias, confección de mantas, macramé, artesanía, venta de papa.

La señora Blanca, indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es clienta en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de prendas de vestir, ella cuenta que inicio este negocio hace años, mediante un trabajo anterior donde ella trabajaba de operaria, posteriormente estableció un taller en el que trabaja actualmente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de tela) mismo que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en las ferias de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Rosas de Viacha” (Viacha Roses) will start the sixth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 11 members led by a governing board headed by Blanca, the President.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: neighborhood store, clothing sales, veil sales, stocking sales, blanket sales, macramé, crafts and potato sales.

Blanca indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for two years having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a client of the institution.  She currently has a business making and selling articles of clothing.  She relates that she started the business years ago through a job she had; later on she set up her own shop where she works to date.

The loan she’ll take out now is to expand her merchandise.  She will buy fabric from suppliers in the city of El Alto.  Once production is done she will sell it in street markets in the city of La Paz.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family the best way possible since she’s married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services and the credit.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Rubidia Milagro

texts.es:
Rubidia, quiere surtir más el negocio por eso está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo, que le permitan los recursos económicos para poder comprarse verduras y frutas frescas para fortalecer el negocio, adquiriendo tomates, cebollas, aguacates, sandías, fresas, peras, entre otra variedad que existe en el mercado.

Ella manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior que le ayudó a lograr una buena inversión, manteniendo fortalecido el negocio y surtido de frutas y verduras. Su condición familiar se ha mantenido hasta el momento, las utilidades recibidas del negocio le han permitido cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, a futuro su objetivo es agregar otro rubro de venta.
texts.en:
Rubidia wants to better stock her business so is once again asking for a loan to have the economic resources needed to buy vegetables and fresh fruit to strengthen the business.  She will buy tomatoes, onions, avocadoes, watermelons, strawberries and pears among other varieties existing in the market.

She states that her previous loan had a positive effect in that it was a good investment.  Her business was strengthened and it stayed afloat stocked with fruit and vegetables.  Her family situation is stable at the moment.  Profits from the business were used to cover her household needs.  Her future goal is to add another line to her sales.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo con su anterior credikiva compró 500 pollos, 65 gallinas ponedoras, 10 cerdos 9 bultos de concentrado y le fue muy bien con sus principales clientes que son las tiendas. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, porque requiere fondo de efectivo para comprar pollo y gallinas ponedoras, porque ahora su negocio es con los supermercados, que ya le han encargado sus productos. Alfredo envía un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva:    ”Muchas gracias por su apoyo él ha sido fundamental para el crecimiento y organización de mi negocio“
texts.en:
Alfredo used his previous Kiva loan to buy 500 chickens, 65 laying hens, 10 pigs and 9 lots of concentrated feed.  Things went very well with his main customers who are stores.

Alfredo is now applying for a new Kiva loan because he needs cash funds to buy chickens and laying hens as his business is now with the supermarkets who have already started placing orders with him.  Alfredo sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Many thanks for your support.  It has been essential in growing and managing my business".

loans.use: to buy chickens and laying hens

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Moses.  He is married and has two children aged 20 and 17 years.  In 1994, Moses established his local foodstuffs business. He began his business as a source of revenue for him and family. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Moses has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy 12 bags of beans @ le 400,000 and the remaining Le. 200,000 will be used for transportation. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 900,000. In the future, Moses plans to expand his business.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 12 bags of beans @ le 400,000; the remaining Le. 200,000 will be used for transportation.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has one child.  In 1998, Mohamed established his provisions and drinks business. He began his business because he came from Guinea to live with his uncle to assist him in his business, so after some years, his uncle helped him to stand on his own by establishing his own business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy one deep freezer @ Le 4,500,000 and the balance Le 500,000 will be used to buy soft drinks. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 900,000. In the future, Mohamed is planning to open another shop at the heart of the city so that he can transfer there and leave his younger brother at the original shop.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy one deep freezer @ Le 4,500,000; the balance of Le 500,000 will be used to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Patricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de juguetes, venta de chicharron, artesanía de pelotas, venta de CD’s, venta de comida, venta de fruta, venta de AVON, costura.

La señora Patricia, indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es clienta en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas, ella cuenta que inicio este negocio hace años, apoyando a su madre en este negocio, posteriormente ella inicio su propio negocio en el mismo rubro.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de frutas.) mismo que adquirirá de las fronteras de Bolivia y Perú, posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la orientación que reciben las socias.
texts.en:
The "FLOR NACIENTE” community bank are starting their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which has Patricia as its president.  The businesses that the members of the group are engaged in are varied and include: selling toys, selling 'chicharrón', hand-making balls, selling CDs, selling food, selling fruit, selling Avon products and sewing.

Patricia has been a member of Pro Mujer for four loan cycles.  She joined through an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling fruit.  She says that she has been in this business for years.  She started out supporting her mother and then started her own business in the same field.

Patricia will use the loan that she is taking out to expand her merchandise (buying fruit).  She will buy her products on the border between Bolivia and Peru and then sell them in the street markets in the city of La Paz.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  Patricia is single and has one daughter.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Patricia replied that she likes the guidance that members receive.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Alpha.  He is married and has one child aged 4 years. He has no additional dependents.  In 2004, Alpha established his pharmacy business. He began his business just after he completed his high school education and could not study further due to his parents' lack of means to sponsor him. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Alpha has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy pharmaceutical drugs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 906,640. In the future, Alpha plans to start selling wholesale.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Tres Esquinas - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA JULIA MILAGROS DE 36 AÑOS DE EDAD PERTENECE AL GRUPO TRES ESQUINAS, GRUPO FORMADO POR 10 SOCIAS, ELLA SE CARACTERIZA POR SER LA MAS ENTUSIASTA Y RESPONSABLE DEL GRUPO, NOS CUENTA QUE CONVIVE CON EL PADRE DE SUS 02 MENORES HIJOS, EL TRABAJA COMO MÚSICO Y SOLO TRABAJA EVENTUALMENTE, POR ESO QUE ELLA JUNTÓ UN POCO DE DINERO PARA QUE PUEDA EMPRENDER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO, Y APOYAR EN LA MANUTENCIÓN DE SU FAMILIA. JULIA QUIERE ABASTECERSE DE MERCADERÍA Y SURTIR SU PEQUEÑA BODEGA, YA QUE SE ACERCAN VARIAS FESTIVIDADES EN SU LOCALIDAD Y SABE QUE LAS VENTAS VAN A MEJORAR, ES POR ESO QUE ELLA SOLICITA EL PRÉSTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE ARROZ, AZÚCAR, LECHE,FIDEOS; ETC.
JULIA MILAGROS ESTA UBICADA EN LA PARTE POSTERIOR, ES LA SEGUNDA DE LA DERECHA, VISTE CON UNA CHOMPA COLOR CELESTE A CUADRITOS Y UN POLO NARANJA.* EN LA PARTE SUPERIOR SE ENCUENTRA KATTY LILIANA VESTIDA CON UN SACO COLOR BLANCO Y LA SEÑORA LIDIA QUE VISTE CON CHOMPA COLOR NEGRO.
texts.en:
Julia Milagros is 36 years old and belongs to the 'Tres Esquinas' group.  This group has ten members.  Julia is noted for being the most enthusiastic and responsible member of her group.  She tells us that she lives with the father of her two children.  He works as a musician but only works on a casual basis.  For this reason, she put aside a little money to start her own business so that she could help support their family.  Julia would like to stock up with merchandise for her small store as there are a number of festivities approaching in her town and she knows that her sales will improve.  She is requesting her loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.  

In the photo, Julia Milagros is in the second row.  She is second from the right and wearing a sky-blue sweater with little squares and an orange top.  

The [individual] photos at the top are of Katty Liliana (wearing a white jacket) and Lidia (wearing a black sweater).

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, tiene 44 años de edad y es madre soltera de 1 hija. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años y tiene un negocio donde vende bebidas y refrescos. Ella dice que pertenecer a FINCA Perú es una buena experiencia ya que en su Banco Comunal le brindan capacitaciones con las que aprende mucho. Su sueño para el futuro de seguir adelante y siempre superarse para que pueda mejorar su vida al lado de su niña. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de bebidas como refrescos, gaseosas, jugos entre otros.
texts.en: Cristina is a member of La Paz community bank.  She is 44 years old and the single mother of one daughter.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years and has a business selling soft drinks and soda.  She says that belonging to FINCA Peru is a good experience because they provide her with training sessions through her community bank and she learns a lot from them.  Her dream for the future is to make progress and always do well so that she can improve both her own life and that of her daughter.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying soft drinks, soda, juices, etc.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soda, juices, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is single with no children, but she takes care of her mother and young sisters. The family lives in a rented house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food for the family.

Mary has a bakery and works six days a week there. She has done so for two years, selling to all who come. She also teaches part-time. Her major business challenges include the threat of thieves and the increasing prices of cooking oil and baking flour in Uganda.

Mary has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cartons of baking flour, jerrycans of cooking oil and cowpeas. Her aspiration is to own a big bakery so that she can become a supplier. She also wants to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour, cooking oil and cowpeas for her bakery.

loans.name: Gs Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La señora Francis de 35 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus 4 hijos quienes viven en su casa de habitación, ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, dedicándose a varias actividades como ser: la venta de tamales, golosinas, anteriormente vendía achinería en  el Amatillo, tuvo que cambiar de actividad debido a que tiene su hija muy pequeña y no tiene quien se la cuide es por eso que hoy se dedica a otras actividades en su casa.
Doña Francis solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como  leña, carnes, maíz, harinas, azúcar que son los productos que ella necesita para realizar sus ventas.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir creciendo al igual que sus demás compañeras de grupo quienes se dedican al negocio de pulpería, ellas son ARLIS Y DOÑA DILCIA ambas residentes en la comunidad de San Lorenzo.
Doña Francis su sueño es tener un buen negocio de golosinas.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Francis, 35, lives with her spouse and four children in their home located in the community of San Lorenzo in south Honduras.  She does a variety of things like: selling tamales and snacks.  She used to sell low-cost knick-knacks in El Amatillo but had to change her activity because her daughter is very little and she does not have anyone to watch over her which is why she now does other activities at home.

Francis is asking for the loan to buy products like firewood, meat, corn, flour and sugar which are the products she needs to make her sales.

With support from this loan she intends to continue investing in her business and continue growing like the rest of the members of her group who are grocers.  They are Arlis and Dilicia, both residents of San Lorenzo.

Francis’ dream is to have a good snacks business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-June, 2012

loans.use: to buy firewood, meat, corn, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mirtha Liliana

texts.es: La Sra. Mirtha tiene 40 años con un hijo de cinco años,   ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales dietéticos de una línea muy conocida a nivel mundial  su tienda se encuentra en la localidad de la Guardia,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mirtha utilizara el dinero del préstamo   para ampliar la gama de productos naturales dietéticos que vende, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece, Mirtha enfrenta retos en su negocio como mejorar su negocio en cuanto a variedad, ya que existe mucha competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de productos de nutrición, su deseo es tener un negocio estable y rentable donde ofrezca variedad de productos naturales que ofrecer a su clientela, de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mirtha, 40, has a five-year-old son.  She sells natural dietetic products of a world renowned brand.  Her store is located in Guardia.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution.

Mirtha will use the money from the loan to expand the scope of natural dietetic products she sells.  Her reason for requesting the loan is that she does not have enough money to expand the variety of products she offers.

The business challenge Mirtha faces is how to improve the business with respect to variety since there is much competition and she will use profits to buy nutritional products.  Her wish is to have a stable, profitable business where she offers a variety of natural products to her clientele.  In this way she will improve her income and as a result her entire family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of natural dietary products.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder darle mantenimiento al taxi, ya que es su responsabilidad brindar a los pasajeros un viaje seguro y comodo, por esta razon acostubra cada cierto tiempo poderlo chequear con un mecanico, al mismo tiempo comprar los repuestos que sean necesarios, ya que este servicio es la unica fuente de ingreso.

El efecto que tuvo un préstamo anterior fue generar una mejor prestación de servicios y garantizar mejores ingresos para el sostén familiar y para cubrir otras obligaciones.
texts.en:
Oscar is requesting a new loan to provide maintenance on his taxi.  He will do this because it is his responsibility to give his passengers a safe and comfortable trip.  This is the reason he usually, every so often, has a mechanic check his taxi.  He will also use the loan to buy the needed replacement parts.  This taxi service is his only source of income.

The effect that the previous loan had was to generate better services and to guarantee better income in order to support his family and cover his obligations.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Florante

texts.en:
Florante is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. For the past five years Florante has run a sari-sari (general store) where he sells canned goods, personal care and home use products, snacks and beverages.

Florante has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. He is applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Florante’s ambition is to grow his business so he can educate his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 28 años y es soltera, se dedica al servicio de enfermería en su tienda  que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Fátima,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios y medicamentos  para su negocio, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son superarse económicamente y profesionalmente y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando su trabajo. Su deseo para su negocio es tener su propia enfermería, bien equipada, la Sra. María también desea poder trabajar en un hospital de segundo nivel, la Sra. María es una persona joven emprendedora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: María is 28 years old and single.  She provides nursing services in her premises which are located in Villa Fátima district.  This loan is her second from the institution.  She will use it to buy accessories and medicines for her business.  María faces challenges in her business such as making progress both financially and professionally.  She will use her profits to continue improving her work.  Her wish for her business is to have her own well-equipped rural health clinic.  She would also like to be able to work in a hospital.  María is a young, entrepreneurial person who has a great desire to make progress in life.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy accessories and medicines for her business

loans.name: Zoir

texts.ru: Зоир проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу. Он развозит пассажиров по установленному маршруту. Кредит берет для приобретения маршрутки марки STAREX.
texts.en: Zoir lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 27 years old, he is married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. He provides a shuttle service and transports passengers on a specified route. He is taking out the loan to buy a small shuttle bus by the make of Starex.

loans.use: to purchase a shuttle bus by the make of STAREX.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Imelda has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for five years. She requested a loan for  PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, beverages. Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Fanny Mabel

texts.es:
Fanny, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio, es decir  pues considera ser una buena alternativa y contar con una buena atención y servicio por parte de la institución, su compra será en pan, carne, salchicha, aderezos, condimentos y aceite, éstos son necesarios para realizar la venta de panes y hamburguesas permitiéndole a ella tener los insumos necesarios para realizar la venta.

Manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior ha logrado tener un buen nivel de producción y de ventas, con las ganancias ha podido ayudar a su familia en las necesidades básicas que a diario se presentan en cada hogar.
texts.en:
Fanny is requesting a new loan in order to be able to invest in the business.  She considers this to be a good choice, and the institution treats her well.

She will buy bread, meat, sausages, dressings, condiments, and cooking oil.  She needs these to make her sandwich and hamburger sales.  This purchase will allow her to have the supplies she needs to make sales.

She says that with the previous loan she has managed to have a good level of production and sales.  She has been able to use her income to help her family with the daily necessities that occur in every household.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, sausages, dressings, condiments, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is 33 years old, separated from her husband and has one child. For the past five years she has run a sari-sari (general store) where she sells canned goods, personal care and home use products, snacks and beverages.

Melona has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. She is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Melona’s ambition is to grow her business so she can educate her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. For the past eight years Ricardo has run a sari-sari (general store) where he sells canned goods, personal care and home use products, snacks and beverages.

Ricardo has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. He is applying for a loan of 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Ricardo’s ambition is to grow his business so he can educate his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lerna

texts.en: Lerna is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children. Lerna has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for  5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Lerna has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Lerna hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Maribel has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for  PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Maribel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Maribel hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Melissah

texts.en:
Melissah is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Melissah is selling green bananas in her local community. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more green bananas to resell.

Melissah has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Melissah hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase green bananas to resell

loans.name: Gs Colinas De Guambuco Group

texts.es:
El Señor Wilfredo, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos dependientes de el, esta casado, Su actividad principal es la caficultura tiene 3 manzanas de finca de café desde hace más de 9 años.
Don Wilfredo esta solicitando el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su finca de café para compra de fertilizantes, plaguicidas y pago de empleados,  para  mejorar la productividad de su finca ya que por la falta de financiamiento no le ha podido dar el mantenimiento adecuado, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba don Wilfredo, le contribuirá a tener una mejor producción de café en su finca, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Don Wilfredo junto a su esposa han trabajado  muy duro para contar con el patrimonio familiar ya que en esta actividad se tiene que trabajar muy duro, uno de los sueños de don Wilfredo es tener una de los mejores fincas tecnificadas de la zona lo que le generaría recursos para darle una mejor calidad de vida su familia.
Junto a sus compañeros caficultores se asociaron para formar un grupo con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar sus fincas siendo los demás integrantes. Olman y Luís todos ellos productores de sus propias parcelas contando con mucha experiencia en el manejos de sus fincas.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Junio 2012
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 38 years old.  He is married and has six dependent children.  His main business activity is growing coffee.  He has three 'manzanas' (1 manzana = 1.72 acres) of coffee plantation which he has owned for more than nine years.

Wilfredo is requesting a loan to maintain his coffee plantation.  He will buy fertilizers and pesticides, and pay laborers to improve the productivity of his farm because, owing to a lack of money, he has not been able to provide it with adequate maintenance.  With the support of this loan, Wilfredo will enjoy a better coffee production which will allow him to make better income with which to cover his household expenses and provide his family with a better quality of life.

Wilfredo and his wife have worked very hard to build up their family assets because you have to work very hard in this business.  One of Wilfredo's dreams is to have one of the best farms using modern technology in his area.  This will make him more money so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

Wilfredo and his fellow coffee growers came together to form a group so that they could request a loan to improve their farms.  The other members are Olman and Luís.  They both grow coffee on their own land and have a lot of experience in running their farms.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - June 2012

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay laborers to sow coffee

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is Sabina, 48, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jesus and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Sabina operates a furniture-making business. She buys raw materials, specifically bamboo, for making bamboo sets, tables, and beds. Her finished products are displayed in a place where they can be easily seen by customers, and when someone buys a piece they will deliver it to the place where the product will be displayed. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sabina dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and she also hopes to reach more customers in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Gerito

texts.en:
Gerito is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 

Gerito provides multi-cab services. He has had this business for 4 years. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for his car's gasoline.

Gerito has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Gerito hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for his car's gasoline

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de una hija. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 6 años y se dedica a la venta de discos compactos de música cristiana. La lección más profunda que ha aprendido con las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal es la importancia de ser responsable y puntual. Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa construida y brindarle una buena educación a su niña. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más discos compactos al por mayor.
texts.en: Marisol is a member of the La Paz communal bank. She is 26 years old. She cohabits and is the mother of a daughter. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 6 years, and she sells CDs of Christian music. The most profound lesson she has learned with the loans she receives in her communal bank is the importance of being responsible and punctual. Her dream for the future is to have her house built and to give her daughter a good education. She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase more CDs at wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase more compact discs at wholesale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. For the past six years Arlene and her husband have sold vegetables in their local community, using their motorcycle to deliver vegetables to stores.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. She is applying for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more vegetables to sell and gasoline for their motorcycle. Arlene’s ambition is to grow her business so she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell and gasoline for their motorcycle.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine runs a bakery. She started this business together with her husband, Gnel, who had worked in another bakery before, and three years ago decided to start his own bakery. Hermine and Gnel organize the production process with hired workers. Gnel also delivers the bread to shops in the village and neighboring villages. In the bakery they produce different types of breads, including the Armenian national bread, lavash. 

Hermine wants to purchase special equipment for the paste kneading process. She also plans to renovate the bakery to have more comfortable conditions. For this aim she will purchase some construction materials. 

The development of the business is important for Hermine to have additional income, which she plans to invest in the bakery's expansion: she would like to start production of pasta, too. This loan is important for Hermine to implement these goals and provide a stable income for her family. Hermine lives with her husband and son.

loans.use: to pay for equipment for making bread and construction materials to renovate the bakery

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. For the past nine years Merilyn has run a sari-sari (general store) where she sells canned goods, personal care and home use products, snacks and beverages.

Merilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. She is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Merilyn’s ambition is to grow her business so she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is single and 60 years old. She resides in Mailen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gloria buys and sells fruits and snack items for a living. She's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP from doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more fruits to sell. In 2007, Gloria joined GDMPC. In the future, Gloria wants to make an expansion to her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married, with seven children. She is 36 years old and lives in Panta-on, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Gina owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns PHP 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Gina has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Gina's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a new house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals for her banana plot.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has been running a hairdressing salon for 12 years. During this period, due to the high quality of services, Mariam has gained a large number of clients. Now she would like to replace her furniture and hair dressing equipment. This is important for Mariam to stay competitive with other salons and attract new clients. Mariam also wants to expand her business. She has a special place and all necessary conditions to open salons for shaping and massage. To implement these goals, she needs to purchase special equipment for these salons, too. This loan will help Mariam to reach these goals and promote her business. 
Mariam lives with her husband, a police officer, and 2 children. Development of the salon is important for this purposeful woman to gather more income from the business, which allows her to save for her children’s future educational costs.

loans.use: to pay for furniture, equipment for hair dressing, shaping and massage salons

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. For the past eight years Rosalinda has run a sari-sari (general store) where she sells canned goods, personal care and home use products, snacks and beverages.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. She is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rosalinda’s ambition is to grow her business so she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Socias Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOCIAS POR SIEMPRE” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tapicería, venta de chuño y papa, tejido de lana y macramé, comedera, tienda de abarrotes, venta de llantas, costura de pantalones.

La señora Patricia, indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, ella cuenta que inicio este negocio por emprendimiento propio y que el préstamo que le dio la institución le ayudo a agrandar su tienda.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de arroz, fideo, azúcar) mismo que adquirirá de los almacenes de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos, el área de salud y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The "Socias Por Siempre" ("Members Forever") communal bank will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is comprised of seven members and is directed by a board, where Rosa is the Treasurer. The members of the association have a variety of businesses. Among them we have: upholstery, selling chuño (artisanal freeze-dried potato) and potatoes, weaving wool and macramé, food, grocery store, selling tires, sewing pants.

Patricia indicates that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago at the invitation of a promoter from the institution. Now she has a neighborhood store. She says that she started this business on her own initiative and that the loan the institution gave her helped her to expand her store. 

The loan that she will now receive is for the expansion of her merchandise (purchase of rice, pasta, and sugar), which she will acquire at the warehouses in the city of El Alto and then sell in her store. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she is married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans, the health area, and the trainings.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Delta

texts.en:
This is Delta, 56 years old and a resident of Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Luisito, a carpenter.  He and Delta have one child.  Delta, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business.

Delta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one packet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and reselling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Delta hopes her business will expand and grow into a mini-grocery through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery products and other items for her store.

loans.name: Pinena

texts.en:
Pinena is married and works hard to support her family. For the past seven years she has run a food vending business in the Philippines.

Pinena is applying for a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. Her ambition is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 47-year-old married mother of four children. For over five years she has made a living running a sari-sari (general store) where she sells a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 3,000 PHP a month from her store.

In 2007 Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to its loans so she could improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. to sell in her sari-sari. She plans to save the additional revenue generated as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, tiene 36 años de edad y es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa en un mercado local. La lección más profunda que ha aprendido es la responsabilidad, también ha aprendido la importancia de la puntualidad y de siempre guardar algo de dinero para ahorrar. Su sueño para el futuro es progresar al lado de sus hijos El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como casacas, pantalones, chompas, blusas.
texts.en: Felicitas is a member of the communal bank La Paz. She is 36 years old and is a single mother of two children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for three years and she works selling clothing in a local market. The most profound lesson she has learned is responsibility. She has also learned the importance of punctuality and always keeping some money to save. Her dream for the future is to advance alongside her children. The loan she is applying for will be invested in the purchase of merchandise like jackets, pants, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.use: to buy clothing like jackets, pants, sweaters, and blouses

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz y tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 1 hijo varón. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y medio y se dedica a la venta de lana, palo, y tiene un área de recreación pequeña que todavía está en construcción.  Ella dice que en todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ha aprendido mucho el valor del ahorro. Su sueño es de un día tener una gran área de recreación donde se pueda invitar a las turistas para ofrecerles tours de las varias regiones del Perú y servir platos típicos en su propio restaurante. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su área de recreación, para comprar más mesas, sillas, plantas y otras cosas para el ambiente.
texts.en:
Gloria, 31,  is a member of the communal bank La Paz [Peace], lives with her life partner, and is the mother of a one-year-old son. She has been a member of  FINCA Perú for a year and a half. She sells wool and is building a small recreation area. She says that during the time she has been a member of FINCA Perú, she has learned a lot about the value of saving.  

Her dream is to have a larger recreation area to which she can invite tourists, offer them tours of different regions in Peru, and serve them local dishes in her own restaurant. She will use this loan to buy more tables, chairs, plants, and other things to improve the ambiance of her recreation area.

loans.use: to buy more tables, chairs, plants, and other things for her recreation area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hats for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell such as puya raimondii, hydrangeas, marguerite daisies, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder continuar invirtiendo en el negocio, además que considera haber recibido un buen servicio y atención, ella comprará harina, huevos, azúcar, jaleas, entre otros materiales necesarios para elaborar pan, este préstamo le dará a Rosa lo necesario económicamente para que ella pueda fortalecer la panadería.

Manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior ha logrado permanecer con la producción de pan, es decir un crecimiento para ella ya que los materiales los ha tenido a su alcance y le han permitido continuar en la producción, hoy en día manifiesta tener mejores condiciones y una mejor solvencia económica que antes.
texts.en:
Rosa is requesting a new loan so that she can continue investing in her business because she believes that she has received good service and attention.  She will buy flour, eggs, sugar, gelatin and other materials she needs for making bread.  This loan will give Rosa the money she needs to strengthen her bakery.

Rosa says that, with the help of her previous loan, she managed to continue making her bread.  She experienced growth as she had all the materials she needed to hand.  This allowed her to continue producing.  She now enjoys better conditions and better financial solvency than before.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar and gelatin

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
This is Jose who is married to Jefanese. He previously received an 8,000 PHP loan that he used to buy more grocery items and products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for this couple’s personal, household and business expenditures.

Jose is applying for another 8,000 PHP loan to be used to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. He feels the more items in his store, the better, as the more items to sell, the greater profits he will realize. These profits will definitely help him to sustain the couple’s daily needs and his business expenditures.

Jose hopes to be able to expand his shop soon. He looks forward to increased profits with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jose faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. All CCT community clients are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell.

loans.name: Susie Jean

texts.en:
Susie Jean is married with five kids. She is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Susie Jean is a farmer who operates a small coconut plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for 23 years, and every month she earns PHP 4,000 from this work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay labor costs in farm maintenance. 

Susie Jean joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Susie Jean hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to pay labor costs in farm maintenance.

loans.name: Lavender

texts.en:
Lavender is married and has two children. She is 32 years old and resides at Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Lavender buys and sells bananas for a living and she has been eight years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more bananas and obtain other fruits to sell. 

In 2010, Lavender joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to build a house and wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and obtain other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Gs Araujo Iv Group

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada 100% a su negocio, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. En Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 12 años de tener este tipo de negocio de pulpería.
Doña Juana el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, refrescos, azúcar, café, pan, harina, arroz, frijoles y verduras y de esta manera incrementar más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera mejorar sus ventas y a si atender mejor a sus clientes. Con estos fondos espera que su negocio sea más sólido y rentable.
Doña Juana sus sueños es poder  y darles a sus hijos una  mejor educación y ayudar a su familia que son de escasos recursos económicos 
Emilia se dedica a su negocio propio venta de ropa nueva desde hace mas de 16 años en el mercado de esa zona.
Dania se dedica su negocio propio compra y venta de ganado. Desde hace mas de 3 años en varios caseríos de la zona.
Choluteca Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Juana is a very enterprising person who is 100% dedicated to her business. She lives with her husband and 4 children in Choluteca in the south of Honduras. She has had this type of grocery business for more than 12 years. Juana will invest the loan in the purchase of corn, soft drinks, sugar, coffee, bread, flour, rice, beans, and vegetables and this way she will increase her sales.

With the loan she hopes to improve her sales and serve her customers better. With these funds, she hopes that her business will be more solid and more profitable. Juana's dreams are to able to give her children a better education and help her family who have scarce economic resources.

Emilia has been working for over 16 years in her own clothing sales business in the market in this area.

Dania has worked in her own business buying and selling livestock in several small villages in the area for more than three years.

Choluteca, Honduras - June 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, soft rinks, sugar, coffee, bread, flour, rice, beans, and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Ana Balbina

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio surtiendo de una variedad de prendas enchapadas como lo son collares, pulseras, anillos, entre otros que son necesarios para poder salir a ofrecer a su clientela, esto le ayudará a poder darle mantenimiento su negocio ya que es su fuente de trabajo.
El efecto que tuvo con préstamo anterior fue mejorar la disponibilidad de mercadería en el negocio, logrando ofrecerle mejores ofertas y estilos a sus clientes, su situación una familia se mantiene hasta el momento ha logrado tener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades, su esposo le está ayudando en lo más necesario.
texts.en: Ana is applying for a new loan to be able to invest in the business, stocking it with a variety of plated pieces like necklaces, bracelets, rings, among other things that are necessary to offer her customers. This will help her be able to provide support for her business as it is her source of work. The previous loan had the effect of improving the availability of merchandise in the business. She was able to provide better offers and styles to her customers. Until now her family has had the required income to cover its necessities. Her husband is helping her with what is needed the most.

loans.use: to purchase necklaces, bracelets, rings

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en: Annalyn is from Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is 32 years old and single. She cooks and sells daily dishes for a living. Annalyn has been in her business for three years and earns 8,500 PHP a month for these activities. This year, Annalyn joined GDMPC and is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks to expand her services. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks to expand her services.

loans.name: Adilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adilia, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para poder continuar invirtiendo en el negocio, comprando sólo materiales necesarios en la producción de las pupusas, como lo es el maíz, aceite, repollo, condimentos, quesillo, que son los más necesarios para continuar en la producción de su venta.

Con el préstamo anterior se ha logrado permanecer en la venta, permitiendo tener lo necesario al alcance, para poder trabajar, sus condiciones están mejorando poco a poco y ha contado con los ingresos necesarios para poder cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Adilia decided to apply for a new loan in order to continue to invest in her business by buying the main ingredients to make her pupusas [Salvadoran grilled, stuffed corncakes].  Ingredients such as corn oil, cabbage, spices and cheese, as these are the most needed to continue production and sales.

With the previous loan, she managed to stay in business providing her the necessities to continue her work.  Bit by bit, work conditions are improving and she can count on enough earnings to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn oil, cabbage, spices, cheese.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, 42 years old and a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines.   Her husband is Angelito, a driver. Together with her husband, Marissa  manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and for their children.

Marissa maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange.  When a customer orders something, the dealer pays cash for the product and then gives it to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit.  Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the customer catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are collecting as their income.  Marissa's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan.   She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marissa fervently hopes that her children will be able to finish college. She also hopes to have more income. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Nemfa

texts.en: Nemfa is from Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, ZDS, Philippines. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living, Nemfa runs a general store, selling a variety of food and household products such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo and soaps to members of the local community. Nemfa has been in business for 27 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Nemfa joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rolando De Jesus

texts.es:
Rolando, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder realizar la compra de insumos agrícolas para su nueva siembra, tales como el abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, esta inversion le ayuda a prevenir las plagas en el cultivo y a fortalecer la producción.

El manifiesta que su experiencia con el préstamo anterior le ha permitido crecer y tener lo necesario para trabajar la agricultura, recibiendo una buena cosecha que le ha generado ingresos a su familia por la venta de la misma, esta condición le permite a Rolando el deseo de continuar trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Rolando is requesting a new loan in order to purchase farm supplies for his new crops, such as fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides. This investment helps him keep pests away from his plants and strengthen his produce. 

He states that the previous loan allowed him to grow and to get what he needed in order to work as a farmer. He obtained a good harvest, which generated income for his family when it was sold. This situation allows Rolando the desire to continue working with the institution.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Revendeuse de cartes de recharges depuis 2009, Madame Abla est mariée à un transitaire. Il exerce son activité de façon ambulante. Vu que ses clients augmentent de jour en jour, elle sollicite un second crédit de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux les satisfaire. Elle veut dans l’avenir se lancer dans d’autres domaines d’activités, être grossiste et mieux prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Abla has worked reselling phone recharge cards since 2009, and is married to a forwarding agent. She sells her products on the street. 

As her customer numbers are increasing every day, Abla has requested a second loan from WAGES to buy supplies of merchandise, so that she can meet demand. In the future she would like to have other businesses, become a wholesaler, and better provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cellphone recharge cards

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es: José  compró tambores y helado para surtir los carros que posee para la venta de este producto, así contribuyó una vez mas al deleite de jóvenes y niños. En la actualidad quiere hacer una nueva inversión, por eso reparará sus triciclos para ejercer su tarea diaria  con mayor efectividad y comprará mas tambores de helados. Su meta mas adelante es terminar de construir su casa, para mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales, pues con la lluvia se ve afectado él y su familia. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es de agradecimiento, pues los créditos que le han facilitado son menos costosos y paga más cómodamente, además de que con ellos ha logrado invertir bien y aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
José buys blocks of ice and ice cream treats to stock his carts, which he uses to travel around and sell ice cream, to the delight of the children in his area. He wants to invest in repairing his tricycles and purchasing ice cream products to make his business more effective.

His goal is to eventually finish construction of his house and improve his living conditions, since his home and family were affected by heavy rains. José is grateful for the support he has received, as he has been able to acquire loans with reasonable payment plans. With the support from previous loans, he has been able to increase his working capital and invest in his business.

loans.use: to repair his tricycles and purchase blocks of ice and ice cream treats.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
This is Sandra, 39, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Giovani, a vendor, and is the mother of six children. She manages her family household together with her husband while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sandra is a dried fish dealer and vendor. She buys a certain kind of fish and then processes it and lets it dry until it is ready to be sold in the market. Her store is located in a temporary fish market.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more fish needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sandra hopes to increase her customers and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship  group members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.*

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yesenia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio y continuar creciendo, se comprará elotes, aceite, para seguir elaborando tamales y salir a vender, este crédito le ayudará para que pueda continuar en su trabajo y seguir generando ingresos para su hogar.
