Christina, who is in her mid 40s, is married with four children, two of them are grown-up and the two are still in college.  She has had a retail shop where she has been selling dry goods like sugar, beans, backing flour, wheat flour, salt, juice, and soda for five years now.

This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the retail shop and pay school fees. She repaid her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more sacks of sugar and rice to resell  Her dream is to one day be able to build her house. 

Christina will hold this loan with her loan group "Pilika" with 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of sugar and rice to resell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 56 years old and is married with eight children. His wife contributes additional income to the family. James has been in business for 13 years and currently has a monthly income of 3,300 KES. This loan will be used to purchase firewood to sell. The anticipated profit will be used to support his family and also pay for school fees.

This is his second loan with KADET LTD, and he successfully repaid the previous one. His hope is to grow his business into a large-scale supplier.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 35 years old. She is married to Henry and together they have two children aged eight and four years old.

She has run a cosmetic shop and a chicken rearing business for three years and earns a monthly income of KES.10,000. The loan will be used to purchase chicken feed and to increase stock for her cosmetic shop, such as braids and beauty products.

The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children. This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she has successfully repaid the previous loan well. Her dreams and hopes are to own a wholesale cosmetic shop.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her chicken rearing business and beauty products for her cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Nazorat

texts.en: Nazorat is a woman who likes to work very much. Some years ago she had a very difficult life and she decided to organize her own business. More than 7 years now she has been busy with growing rice. Her business has been developing year by year as she has accumulated enough experience and skills about the agricultural business. Now, she has her own planting land and some workers. She wants to develop her business further but her income isn't enough. She is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay the salary of workers. Nazorat’s husband and her 2 children help her in the business. They await your help and support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and to pay the salary of workers

loans.name: Aisas' Group

texts.en:
Aisas, who is 39, is a married mother of three who lives in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. The only source of her family’s income is cassava planting on two hectares of farmland. She has been a farmer for two years, and she earns about 29,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Aisas’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Aisas successfully used her first loan to improve her family’s livelihood. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, Aisas will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion to spend on labor and land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and to earn more income to make living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en:
Phen is 37 years old and married. She is blessed with two children, one daughter and one son, who are still in school. Like other villagers in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district, Phen earns a living through rice farming. She has been in this business for several years, earning about 16,000KHR per day. 

Phen has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle and completely paid back the loan while her group member has just joined VisionFund for this loan cycle. The first loan has helped her better support her family’s living. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each, Phen, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and also a piglet as another source of income.  She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business activities and earn more income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Abdumurod

texts.en:
Abdumurod began his own business five years ago, and he is busy with it. He has his own collective farm where he grows watermelon, corn, wheat, carrots and other kinds of vegetables. His business has been developing year-by-year as he has gained experience. 

Abdumurod has a big and friendly family, and he is in business to help his wife and children. They want to develop the farm, and that’s why they need your help and support. He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer. Please help him develop his business.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 44, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jacinto, a mason, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Gina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a common family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 

Gina's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gina dreams to grow her business and be able to give all her children a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie came to the US nine years ago from Venezuela.  When she arrived in NY, she knew very few people.  What motivated Angie was her passion for starting a clothing business.  When she met her now husband, Ricardo de Linares, they decided to join forces and start a business together.  Angie and Ricardo have strong backgrounds in sales and a drive to provide quality clothing. Together, they opened their business, New Style New Life Inc.  Angie is proud of their business. The business has been in operation for over two years. Angie’s business thrives on customer satisfaction and word of mouth.   

Angie wants the store to be more than just a business exchange. She wants to help the clients as much as possible.  Angie wants her clients to leave her store having purchased fashionable tailor-fit pieces. She wants her clients to love the experience of browsing and making purchases in her store.   

Angie and Ricardo hope to use this loan to introduce new inventory into their shop and to purchase more equipment like mannequins and window showcases. With the new equipment, they hope to showcase new lines of clothing to better accommodate customers, and in so doing, improving customer service.  Angie and Ricardo support their two children through this business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and equipment

loans.name: Gavino Marcelino

texts.es:
Don Gavino, sigue ofertando sus productos de cosméticos en variedad, electrodomésticos estos por encargo, en toda esta trayectoria en sus ventas, se siente satisfecho ya que ha logrado el aumento de su negocio, captado clientes, productos que vende son al contado y al crédito, es soltero y ayuda a su mama. El aumento de inventario ha sido con ganancias y préstamos en Afodenic, siendo una puerta de oportunidad.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo es para seguir comprando productos Avon y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, comprara: diez set de perfume de varón, diez set de mujer, vanidad, cremas, maquillaje, pinturas, y otros encargos.
texts.en:
Gavino is still selling a variety of cosmetic products, as well as household appliances by customer order.

Throughout his sales career, he has felt satisfied, as he has achieved growth in his business by winning customers. He sells products for cash and credit. He is single and helps his mother. The increase in inventory has been achieved with earnings, and with loans from Afodenic: a gateway to opportunity.

Today this new loan enables him to continue buying Avon products and meeting his customer demand. He will buy ten sets of men's perfume, ten sets of women's, as well as Vanidad cosmetics, creams, makeup, lipsticks and other catalog products.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, and a variety of products.

loans.name: Kann

texts.en:
Kann is 57 years old and married with four children. She lives with her husband and two single children in a small thatched roof house in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. The remaining two children are already settled in marriage and live separately with their new families. Kann farms her existing land for a living. With the help of her husband in this business, Kann is able to carry out good plants and make yields to support her children’s education. Kann has been doing this for many years.

Kann wants to help her daughter, a traffic policewoman, in her transportation because she has a lot of expenses due to the lack of a vehicle for commuting. Consequently, she would like to take out a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter.  This purchase will help her daughter use her transportation money to better the family’s income. Kann is very grateful for this loan given to help her family, which is in need.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province, Yan is a 58-year-old widow who has three children. She has struggled to earn a living to feed her children through farming rice and sesame and she supplements her income by raising pigs. She has been in the business for 23 years, earning about 19,400 KHR per day. 

Yan’s group consists of three members who live in the same village and she is a first cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group members to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy more piglets and pay for land plowing to plant sesame. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Mulongo

texts.en:
Mulongo is 43 years old and married with four girls and three boys. Four of her children are attending school. Mulongo is a very hardworking woman who has been operating a retail shop for over eight years. To supplement her income, she decided to start a mat-selling business, selling mats at the market. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she lacks operating capital of her own. Mulongo will utilize the benefits so that she can continue to expand her businesses and meet her customer demands.

Mulongo dreams of opening a wholesale business in the future. She will use this loan to add rice, flour, and other fast-selling goods to her shop.

loans.use: to add rice, flour, and other fast-selling goods to her shop.

loans.name: Ndotto

texts.en:
Ndotto is a married mother of six children: three boys and three girls, four of whom attend school. She has been operating a retail shop selling various home products for several years. She buys her merchandise in the nearby town.

With customer demand steadily increasing, she is seeking a loan from Yehu to adequately meet the needs of her clientele and maximize her profits. 

Any surplus earned will allow her to support her children’s education and to replenish her stock. 

Ndotto lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. With the loan, she intends to add to her stock of wheat and maize flour, rice, sugar, and beans. Thanks for the support given.

loans.use: to buy wheat and maize flour, rice, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To repair welding machine for welding business

loans.name: Gulnor

texts.en: Gulnor has been a successful businesswoman for four years. She is busy with animal husbandry. She buys cattle, cares for them and then sells them in the local market. In the local market, she has many customers because her cattle are fat. Many butchers buy cattle from her. With her business, Gulnor helps her husband. They have five children and want to do the best for them. She is asking for a loan to buy young cattle for developing her business. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu, 28, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in a village in the south coast of Kenya.

Mariamu has devoted herself to business for three years. She operates a kiosk, selling a variety of consumer goods. In addition, she sells coconuts from her home. During her free time, Mariam does farming in her small garden located behind her residential house. 

She says that she got her working capital from her husband.  She is currently requesting a loan from Yehu for 25,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy coconuts to sell and add more stock to her kiosk. This loan will help her increase production, and with the income, she will be able to give her family a better life. Thanks for her efforts.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and add more items to her kiosk.

loans.name: Manthooma

texts.en:
Manthooma is 28 years old and married with four children, three of whom are at school.

Manthooma works as a seamstress and owns her own sewing place. She sews pants, gowns and robes.

She asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy more sewing machines and tables for cutting cloth.

Her ambition is to improve her project and increase the family income to provide a better life for her children and family.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines and tables for cutting cloth

loans.name: Eudoxia

texts.es: Eudoxia es socia del Banco Comunal Solución, tiene 59 años de edad y es madre soltera de 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años y es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes,  también se dedica a la compra de cereales que luego vende a terceros. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú aprendió a ser responsable, ella dice que en la Institución le brindan facilidades de préstamos a las socias y otras instituciones no lo hacen, también le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal por que allí aprende mucho. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de granos de cereales y también en compra de abarrotes para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, harina, bebidas y otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Eudoxia is a member of the "Solución" communal bank. She is 59, and the single mother of one son. She has been a member of Finca Perú for five years and is the owner of a grocery store. She also buys cereal grains that she then sells to third parties. 

In all this time as a member of Finca Perú, she has learned to be responsible. She says that at the institution they offer credit to the members, and other institutions do not do so.

She also really likes the training she gets in her communal bank, because she learns a lot there.

She will use the loan she is applying for to buy cereal grains, and also to buy groceries for her store, such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, flour, drinks and other basic household necessities.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store, such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, flour, drinks and other basic household products.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Agée de 37ans et mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés (12ans et 08ans), Madame Akouvi est revendeuse de l’huile rouge (huile obtenue à base de la noix de palme qui se sert à la cuisine dans la préparation de certaines sauces) et de tapioca (une fécule utilisée en cuisine faite à base de manioc). Elle exerce l’activité à domicile et dans un marché de la place à toutes personnes désireuses de s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire ses nombreux clients. Elle veut agrandir le stock et assurer une bonne éducation à ses enfants. Notons que son conjoint est maçon et elle a démarré en 2000.
texts.en:
37 years old and the mother of two children in school (12 and eight years old), Mrs. Akouvi is a retailer of red oil (oil made from palm nuts, which is used in the kitchen in the preparation of certain sauces) and tapioca (a starch used in cooking, made from cassava). She runs the business from home and in a local market, [selling] to all those who wish to purchase her merchandise.

Mrs. Akouvi is on her second WAGES loan and this loan that she is seeking will allow her to purchase more merchandise in order to better meet the needs of her numerous clients. She wants to expand her stock and provide a good education for her children. Please note that her spouse is a mason and that she began [her business] in 2000.

loans.use: To purchase red oil and tapioca.

loans.name: Magnin

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Magnin est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux vont encore à l'école. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la fabrication de fromage et dans la vente l'huile rouge depuis quelques années. Sa clientèle est constituée des habitants du quartier et de ses entourages. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la demande ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de contribuer à la formation professionnelle de ses enfants.
texts.en:
At 44 years old, Magnin is married and the mother of three children, two of whom still attend school. She has been specializing in the manufacturing of cheese and the sale of red oil for several years. Her customers are made up of inhabitants of the neighborhood and its environs. She gets her supplies in the markets of Benin.

With the goal of increasing her sales and meeting customer demand, Magnin has sought and obtained a loan from Finadev. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business and to contribute to her children's professional training.

loans.use: To purchase five cans, 25 liters of red oil, and four sacks of soybeans.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Madame Abra est mère des jumeaux âgés de 03ans. Elle est coiffeuse de profession. Vu que l’activité ne prospère pas comme elle le souhaite, elle a ajouté la vente de produits de mercerie. Elle est une ancienne cliente de notre institution et est à son quatrième crédit chez nous. Avec ce montant, elle espère s’approvisionner en marchandises. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite créer une nouvelle boutique de mercerie et aider ses enfants en grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abra is the mother of three-year-old twins. She is a hairdresser by trade. Given that her business was not as successful as she would wish, she has added the sale of notions. She is a former client of our organization [WAGES] and is on her fourth loan with us.

With this loan, Mrs. Abra hopes to purchase merchandise. In the future, she wishes to establish a new notions shop and to help her children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: To purchase notions items.

loans.name: Nguonkim's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Nguonkim is 29 years old and has no kids yet. He is a local electronics repairer. He repairs televisions, cassettes and CD players etc. while his wife runs a grocery store on the site. He and his wife have been in these businesses for 10 years, earning about 18,000 KHR per day to make a living. 

Nguonkim’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. He is a first time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading his group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each, Nguonkim, who is the leader, will use his portion to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for his repair business and more grocery items

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Glagys

texts.en: Glagys produces fanti kenkey (a fermented maize dough eaten as a traditional dish in Ghana) to sell at Ayensudu near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has two children. Glagys has been selling fanti kenkey for some years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize for the production of her kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize for the production of her kenkey

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 19 years old and lives at Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza.

Abdullah owns a mini-market in Jabalia refugee camp and has been working in it for two years.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy refrigerators and shelves in order to develop his mini-market.

His ambition is to improve his shop and his income in order to get married and have his own family and children .

loans.use: to buy refrigerators and shelves

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es:
Ovidio tiene 45 años. Vive en la casa que compraron hace 10 años en la localidad de Huancas, junto a sus dos hijos; Marleny y José. 
Todas las mañanas, junto a su esposa, se dedica a los oficios que aprendieron desde niños; la agricultura y ganadería. Usan los terrenos de su esposa y otros que alquilan cuando necesitan, allí siembran papa, maíz, habas, linaza, tarwi y otros productos oriundos del lugar. “Hay temporadas en las que tenemos que contratar personal para que nos ayuden a sembrar”, afirma. En cada cosecha vende sus productos a los acopiadores de alimentos de la ciudad, desde donde los llevan a las diversas ciudades del Perú. Mientras trabaja y administra sus cultivos, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus animales, tienen vacas, toros y ovejas, los cuales engordan para luego vender a los carniceros. Así como los 12 litros de leche que extraen, los venden a una procesadora de lácteos.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Cruz de espinas” y este es su séptimo crédito con MFP. Y en todos estos años, gracias a estos préstamos, ha obtenido buenos resultados en su negocio y en su vida personal, por lo que se encuentra agradecido. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, además de que le agrada pertenecer a su asociación, pues se apoyan y son como una familia. 
Ovidio invertirá este dinero en la compra de semilla de habas, fertilizantes naturales, el alquiler de los terrenos y el pago a los peones que trabajarán en voltear la tierra.
texts.en:
Ovidio is 45 years old. He lives in a house bought 10 years ago in the town of Huancas, with his two children, Marlene and Joseph.
Every morning he and his wife devote themselves to the trades they learned as children, agriculture and livestock. They use his wife's land and that of others from whom they rent when needed.  They grow potatoes, corn, beans, flaxseed, lupine and other products native to the area. 

"There are seasons in which we have to hire staff to help us plant," he says.  At each harvest he sells his products to food stockers in the city, who take them to different cities of Peru. As he works and manages their crops, his wife cares for their animals.  They have cows, bulls, and sheep, which they fatten and then sell to butchers. Additionally they extract 12 liters of milk which they sell to a dairy processing factory.

He belongs to the solidarity group "Cross of Thorns" and this is his seventh loan with MFP.  In all these years, thanks to these loans, he has been successful in his business and his personal life; thus, he is grateful. He promises to be timely with his payments.  Plus, he likes to belong to this association for support, and they are like a family.

Ovidio will invest this money in the purchase of bean seeds, natural fertilizer, to pay for renting the land and to pay the laborers who will work on turning over the earth.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds and natural fertilizers

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Divorced and the mother of five children, three of whom are in school, Saumu has been selling omena (small dried fish) for a number of years. She sells her fish from home. Her customer base is large and diverse, composed of people from different regions. In order to increase her sales volume and meet customer demand, she has requested a loan from Kiva partners through Yehu. The current loan will allow her to buy more sacks of omena for sale, and the remaining amount will allow her to pay school fees for her children. Thanks to her savings, Saumu would like to contribute to the cost of professional education for her children, as well as to put some money aside. This is her second loan with Kiva and Yehu. She tells us that the previous loan has really improved her living standard and she hopes to expand her business. She also narrates that she continues to sells fried fish with the help of a cousin.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of omena and to pay school fees

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia sells fanti kenkey (a fermented maize dough eaten as a traditional dish in Ghana) at Ayensudu near Elmina. She is married to a driver and has two children. Sophia has been selling fanti kenkey for some years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility and accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize for the production of her kenkey to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to make kenkey to sell

loans.name: Flor De Lys

texts.es:
Flor se encuentra casada y tiene 4 hijos, y para poder tener mejores condiciones económicas en el hogar decidió montar su propio negocio para poder contribuir económicamente en su hogar junto con su esposo. Fue así como decidió montar un cibercafé aprovechando las oportunidades del sector y gracias al esfuerzo que ha hecho ha logrado sacarlo adelante y poder generar buenos ingresos para el hogar. Desde que tiene su negocio sus 4 hijos han podido tener una educación de mejor calidad asistiendo a mejores colegios y por esto Flor siempre busca que su negocio siga creciendo para que en un futuro puedan también acceder a una educación universitaria. Ahora que tiene una nueva oportunidad espera aprovecharla, y es que espera vender helados dentro de su cibercafé para diversificar sus ingresos y también ofrecer este servicio a sus clientes, es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar el surtido inicial de helados y comenzar a ofrecer este servicio a sus clientes y diversificar sus ingresos.

Con estas nuevas ventas aumentarán los ingresos que tendrán en el hogar y de esta manera la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus 4 hijos mejorará considerablemente, permitiéndole tener también mejores condiciones económicas que les permitan prosperar.
texts.en:
Flor is married and has four children. In order to have a better economic situation in the household, she decided to set up her own business so that she, along with her husband, can contribute financially to the household.

This was how she decided to set up an internet café, taking advantage of the opportunities in the area. Thanks to the effort she has made, she has managed to keep it going and to generate good income for the household. 

Since she has had her business, her four children have been able to have a better quality of education, attending better schools. For this reason, Flor is always aiming for her business to continue growing, so that someday they can also access a university education. 
,
Now that she has a new opportunity, she hopes to take advantage of it. It is that she hopes to sell ice cream inside her internet café, so that she can diversify her income and also offer this service to her customers. This is why she is seeking a loan; in order to purchase the initial supply, begin to offer this service to her customers, and diversify her income.

With these new sales they will increase their household income. This way the quality of life of her husband and four children will improve considerably, allowing her to have a better financial situation that will allow them to prosper.

loans.use: To buy an initial stock of ice cream, and begin offering this service to her customers and diversifying her income.

loans.name: Zarifjon

texts.en: Zarifjon is very kind and cute. For more than three years, he has had own business deal. His skills and experiences help him to be successful in business. He is busy selling pillows, covers and other things. In the local market, he has a selling place and a lot of customers. He has a lovely wife and three children. He has no employees. He developed his business but his income doesn’t enough. He is asking for a loan to buy goods to widen his assortment of goods to sell. He waits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla, aged 42, is a villager from a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district. She is married with five children who work in the family’s business. Phalla and her husband earn a living through farming rice on one hectare of farmland and planting cassava on three hectares of farmland. Having been in the business for almost 20 years, they can earn about 49,000 KHR per day to make a living. 

Phalla has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely repaid her first loan which helped her to improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. Phalla hopes to increase her crop yield and to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for labor costs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian sells cosmetics, hair relaxers and pomade at Ayensudu, near Elmina.  She is married and has been selling cosmetics for the past four years. With her income, she supports her husband in the upkeep of their family. 

Vivian will use her loan to purchase more cosmetics and hair relaxers to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to acquire a shop from where she can sell her cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and hair relaxers to sell.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem, aged 45 and married, lives permanently in Baray district, where she operates rice farming and hog-raising businesses to earn her living. She has a life partner who is very supportive in the businesses. Yem has many years of experience in this type of agricultural business. She normally earns in the vicinity of USD 4.00 per day which she uses for household expenses. Yem has six children, five of whom are single and one is married. Most of her children are employed in various careers, so only her youngest child is still attending school.

Yem has requested a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle for household use, thus meeting her family's needs. This will provide the family with good transportation services especially for her employed children commuting to their workplaces. Also, it will help the family to cut down on some of their transportation expenses. Yem thanks lenders for their consistent support.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has operated a grocery shop at Ayensudu, near Elmina, for some years now. Her grocery shop sells milk, Milo, sugar, soups, soft  drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk and other goods. 

Elizabeth is married with one child and uses her income to support her husband and to pay their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Elizabeth plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of fruit to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah produces fanti kenkey (a fermented maize dough eaten as a traditional dish in Ghana) which she sells at Ayensudu, near Elmina. In the photo, in front of Hannah, are the maize and banana leaves she uses to produce her kenkey for sale.  Hannah is married with children and her husband is a farmer. 

She has been selling fanti kenkey for 10 years now. Hannah uses her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize for making her kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize for making her kenkey.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is a baker who bakes bread for sale. In the photo, she is tending to her oven, making sure it is the right temperature to bake bread. She has been in the baking business for 10 years now. Adjoa lives together with her husband and four children at Ayensudu, near Elmina. 

Adjoa will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery. With the new profits, she will buy a modern type of oven to make her work easier. With this new oven, she will not need to put so much effort into regulating the temperature.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 39 years old, is married and has two children who are school students. He has 15 years' experience as a car and auto electrician. Ahmad set up his own shop on 1 January 2012 and has one employee.

Ahmad has asked Ryada for this loan so he can buy more electrical tools and enlarge the space in his shop. His ambition is to offer his wife and children a better life and better education to improve their future.

loans.use: to buy electrical tools and enlarge the space in his shop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives together with her husband and two children at Ayensudu, near Elmina. She bakes bread which she then sells. In the photo, Sarah is tending her oven, making sure that it's the correct temperature for baking. She has been a baker for six years and uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Sarah will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery. With the new profits, she will buy a more modern oven which will increase her productivity and make her work easier.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram is in his mid-forties, is married and has three children. Two of his children are attending primary and secondary public schools and the youngest one has recently turned three years old. Bajram's family lives in a rocky village in the central eastern part of Albania that sits approximately 500–550 feet (150–170 m) above sea level.

Bajram has recently started a business transporting food and agricultural merchandise in the region and is the only one to offer such services. This is his first Kiva loan through VisionFund Albania (VFA) and he is requesting it to purchase food and agricultural merchandise for wholesale distribution. With any profits, he will be able to support his entire family since he is the only one financially providing for them.

Bajram has been referred to VFA through active clients who talk highly of his responsible nature.

loans.use: To purchase food and agricultural merchandise for wholesale distribution

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 30 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a stable work history selling second-hand clothes, a business she has been in for the past two years. Prisca previously operated a poultry business, although she is now running the two businesses concurrently. According to her work and personal references, she is a very responsible young woman. 

Prisca is requesting this loan to buy bundles of clothes to sell. Her partner in life works as a mason, so both of them earn income for their family and share in the family and household expenses. Her dream is to expand the businesses and even start new ones. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana sells cooking utensils and saucepans at Yabiw near Takoradi.  Susana has been selling these for some years now.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a trader.  She currently uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

Susana will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils.

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en: Sandrine is 22 years old. She sells local soft drinks made out of bananas. She has requested the loan to buy more bananas to make more soft drinks to sell. With the profits from the business, she will build a house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to make local soft drinks.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a food vendor at Ayensudu, near Elmina. She cooks banku (a thick dough-like paste made from maize and cassava) which she sells along with products like fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce which are served with it. Theresa has done this for three years. 

Theresa is married to a farmer and they have six children. She uses her income to assist her husband. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up a food stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and fish for preparing banku

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
Olimjon is a man who likes to work very hard. For more than two years, he has been busy producing bricks. He is very kind, cute and good natured. His skills and experiences help him to be successful in business. He has a lovely wife and four smart children. 

His son helps Olimjon in his business. His wife does the housework and tries to do the best for her family. Olimjon wants to develop his business. He is asking for a loan to buy cement for producing bricks. He waits for your help and support.

loans.use: To buy cement for producing bricks

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a person who has always been known for being a hard worker. Since her husband’s income was not enough to sustain the household expenses, she decided to establish her own business with the intention of contributing financially in order to attain a better quality of life. Florence has been operating a salon for the past year. On the few occasions when her husband is without work, her business is the only source of income that sustains their household.
 
Since she does not have enough capital, Florence is looking to secure a loan in order to buy cosmetics and beauty chemicals to restock her business so she can provide a good variety of goods and services to her customers. In this manner, she hopes to overcome the difficulty of having insufficient capital so that she can move forward with her business.

As a result, Florence will be able to generate more household income, attain a better quality of life and have better financial opportunities for making progress. She wants to make sure that all her children can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty chemicals to restock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 27 years old. She sells different items in her shop which she has been running for the past 10 years. 

Claudine wants to use the loan to buy rice and maize flour to sell. The new profits will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca produces fanti kenkey (fermented maize dough wrapped in banana/plantain leaves) which she sells in Ayensudu, near Elmina. She has been selling fanti kenkey for 10 years now. She is married to a farmer and has nine dependants. 

Rebecca uses her income to support her husband and pay their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize for the production of her kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en: Annonciatha is 27 years old, is married to a tailor and they have three children. She has been selling sodas for the past two years. With the loan, Annonciatha will buy more sodas to sell. She plans to use the profits from the business to build up her savings.

loans.use: To buy more sodas to sell.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Mariée à un géomètre et âgée de 42ans, madame Dédé est mère de famille. Elle a appris la couture. A la fin de son apprentissage, elle a ouvert un atelier en 2008 et coud des habits pour ses nombreux clients. Pour mieux satisfaire ses derniers, elle a décidé de vendre en plus de son activité de couture, de l'eau minérale en sachets du jus qu’elle fait elle – même. Elle sollicite ce troisième crédit de WAGES pour s’acheter un congélateur afin de mieux répondre aux désirs des clients. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Married to a surveyor and 42 years of age, Déde is the mother of a family. She has learned sewing. At the end of her training period, she opened a workshop in 2008 and makes outfits for her numerous customers. To better satisfy them, she has decided to sell - in addition to her sewing activity - mineral water in juice sachets which she prepares herself. 
She is seeking this third loan from WAGES in order to buy a freezer, so she can meet her customers wishes. She wants to invest in the business, and improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Mauya

texts.en:
Mauya is a 47-year-old married man and the father of five children, two of whom are attending school. They are aged between 3-16 years old. Mauya is a casual employee who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past 10 years, he has also been operating a business selling goat meat at the market which has been a profitable project, but it also needs more support to cover the costs.

Mauya is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from Yehu to help him purchase goats for resale. This will improve the family's income. Mauya has a good reputation among customers. In the future, he dreams of expanding the business and starting to purchase cows, in addition to goats.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Gbenablodo Léontine

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont scolarisés, Gbenablodo Léontine vend des condiments, de l'huile rouge et fabrique du fromage communément appelé soja depuis des années. Elle se ravitaille dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle large et variée est constituée essentiellement des vendeuses de nourriture. Soucieuse de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a fait recours au micro crédit de Finadev. Le présent crédit lui permettra d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Married and the mother of four children (three of whom attend school), Gbenablodo Léontine sells condiments and palm oil, and makes the cheese commonly called soya - she has been doing this for years.She buys her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Her broad and varied customer base is mostly made up of food sellers. Motivated to strengthen her operating capital and to be able to meet her customers' demand, she has sought assistance from Finadev's micro-credit programme. This loan will allow her to grow her supplementary income and to participate with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 1 basket of tomatoes, 1 basket of peppers, 2 baskets of onions, 1 x 10 litre can of palm oil and 1 sack of soya.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 33 años. Vive, desde hace 3 años, en la casa de su padre, junto a su hija Jenifer, en la localidad de Ataura. 
Su principal actividad económica es la venta de animales. Compra toros, vacas, ovejas y otros, los que cuida con mucho empeño, ya que su objetivo es engordarlos para venderlos a los carniceros que llegan a su zona. Le va muy bien en su trabajo y espera que dentro de poco pueda aumentar su capital de trabajo para tener mejor ganado, en mayor cantidad. Adicionalmente, desde hace dos meses, comenzó con la compra y venta de ropa, de donde obtiene un ingreso económico diario que le permite solventar los gastos de su hogar. 

Ella ha ingresado al banco comunal “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas de pago.
Liz invertirá este dinero en la compra de más animales, además de ropa variada para seguir con este negocio.
texts.en:
Liz, 33, has lived for three years in her father's house in the town of Ataura, with her daughter, Jenifer.  Her main source of income is animal sales.  She buys bulls, cows, sheep and other animals and takes very good care of them, since her goal is to fatten them to sell to butchers who visit the area.  Work is going well for her and she hopes to be able to increase her capital soon to buy more livestock.  For two months she has also been buying and selling clothing, to earn an extra daily income to help cover household expenses.

She is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo amanecer" and this is her first loan through MFP.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Liz will use the money to buy more livestock, as well as different clothing to continue with her sales.

loans.use: To buy more animals and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mondoukpè Rébécca

texts.fr: Mondoukpè Rébécca est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Mondoukpè Rébécca est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Mondoukpè Rébécca a peu fréquenté l’école. Les trois enfants, sont tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Mondoukpè Rébécca vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Mondoukpè Rébécca vend du maïs depuis onze ans environs. Parallèlement à cette activité, Mondoukpè Rébécca vend des bois de chauffage et des fagots de bois à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Mondoukpè Rébécca désire agrandir son activité, ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante. Pour cette raison, Mondoukpè Rébécca sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mondoukpè Rébécca is 34 years old and lives in Bénin. She is married and the mother of three children. She did not attend much school. The three children are all in school, and living at home.
Mondoukpè Rébécca lives together with her husband and their children. The couple cover the household running expenses together. In order to cover these expenses, Mondoukpè Rébécca has been a corn seller for about eleven years. Alongside this business, she also sells logs and bundles of firewood from her home. This business allows her meet the children's needs. Mondoukpè Rébécca wishes to expand her business, which will allow her to effectively meet the needs of her ever growing-customer base.
For this reason, Mondoukpè Rébécca is seeking a first loan with ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Lisset

texts.es:
Lisset tiene 22 años. Vive, desde hace 15 años, en la casa que cuidan de su tío, junto a su hermano, Harol, y su madre, Elsa, en la localidad de Ataura.  
Ella se dedica a varias actividades. Mientras que atiende su tienda de comestibles que abrió hace 5 años, aprovecha para tejer las hermosas colchas de lana con diversos colores. “Es mi mayor distracción, me gusta mucho tejer puedo hacer muchas cosas hermosas, de mi mente”, comenta. Por esa razón, tiene muchos pedidos, en su mayoría de sus vecinos del barrio. Pero su principal actividad económica es la crianza de pollos, los que cuida en su misma vivienda durante sus tiempos libres. “No requiere de mucha atención, solo tengo que alimentar y sacarlos al aire libre en la mañana y guardarlos en la noche para que descansen”, afirma. Es así, que cada 3 meses, vende los más maduros a sus clientes. 

Ella ha ingresado al banco comunal “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Lisset invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de más pollos, comida balanceada para sus animales, y si le alcanza, madejas de lana para sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Lisset, 22, has lived for 15 years in her uncle's home in the town of Ataura with her brother, Harol, and her mother, Elsa.  She has several businesses.  While she attends to the grocery store she opened five years ago, she knits beautiful bedspreads in different colors.  "It is my best pastime, since I like to knit beautiful things that I create in my mind", she says.  Therefore, she has many orders, most of which are from neighbors.  But her main business is raising chickens, which she cares for at home in her free time.  "They don't need much attention, I just have to feed them and take them outside in the morning and put them back in at night to sleep", she states.  And every three months she sells the most mature ones to her customers.

She has joined the communal bank "Nuevo amanecer" and this is her first loan through MFP.  She is committed to paying it back on time.  Lisset will use the loan to buy more chickens, balanced animal feed, and if there is enough left over, skeins of yarn for her knitting projects.

loans.use: To buy more chickens, animal feed and yarn for her knitting projects.

loans.name: Mètohoué Vincent

texts.fr: Mètohoué Vincent est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Mètohoué Vincent est marié à un certain Célestine.  Mètohoué Vincent a peu fréquenté l’école. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge, dont quatre représentent leurs propres enfants. Mètohoué Vincent et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Mètohoué Vincent vend depuis onze ans environs, des ustensiles de cuisines (marmites, louches etc.) dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Mètohoué Vincent vend des céréales. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de son ménage et de subvenir à ses besoins. Mètohoué Vincent désire mieux renforcer son activité; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Mètohoué Vincent sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mètohoué Vincent is 32 years old and lives in Bénin. He is married to a woman named Célestine. He did not go to school much. The couple have five dependent children, all in school - four of whom are their own. Mètohoué Vincent covers the household expenses together with his wife. 
In order to meet these different expenses, he has sold kitchen utensils (cooking pots, ladles etc.) for the last eleven years or so in his region.
In a secondary capacity, Mètohoué Vincent sells cereals. This activity allows him to cover the household's living costs.
Mètohoué Vincent wishes to strengthen his business; this will allow him to efficiently meet his customer's requirements. For this reason, Mètohoué Vincent is requesting his first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy cooking pots and cereals.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 49 años. Vive, desde hace 20 años, en la casa que heredó de su madre en la localidad de Huancas; junto a sus dos hijos: Luzmila y Melania.  
Hace 12 años que enviudó, desde ese entonces ha trabajado duro para mantener a su familia. Cuenta que siempre le gustó cocinar, su esposa se dedicaba a trabajar como peón en diversos sembríos, mientras él cuidaba de su restaurante, donde vendían comida china. “En mis mejores tiempos, era uno de los mejores restaurantes, cuando mi esposa murió tuve que cerrar”, cuenta con melancolía. Es así que hace pocos meses, retomó el negocio que tanto le gusta, por ahora solo vende los fines de semana en su casa a los pobladores de su localidad. Pero espera reunir lo suficiente, 5 mil soles, para volver a tener su restaurante en el centro de la ciudad.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Cruz de espinas” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. En estos años de trabajo, obtuvo buenos resultados en su negocio, por lo que se encuentra agradecido. Por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le agrada pertenecer a su asociación, pues se apoyan y son como una familia.
Javier invertirá este dinero en la compra de insumos para sus comidas; como cebolla, arroz, azúcar y huevos.
texts.en:
Javier, 49, has lived for 20 years in the house he inherited from his mother in the town of Huancas.  He lives with his two children, Luzmila and Melania.  He became a widower 12 years ago and since then has worked hard to support his family.  He says he has always liked to cook, and while his wife worked as a crop farmer, he ran a restaurant where they sold Chinese food.  "In my best times it was one of the best restaurants, but when my wife died I had to close it", he says with melancholy.  So just a few months ago, he opened the business that he likes so much again, but now he only sells on weekends from home to the local people.  He hopes to raise enough money, 5,000 PEN, to open a restaurant in the center of town.

He belongs to the communal bank "Cruz de espinas" and this is his second loan through MFP.  Over the past few years he has earned a profit through his business, so he is very grateful.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time and is glad to belong to his group because they support each other and are like a family.

Javier will use the loan to buy ingredients for the food he makes, such as onions, rice, sugar and eggs.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for the food he makes.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee tiene 38 años. Desde 13 años, vive en la casa de sus suegros, ubicada en la localidad de Huancas, junto a su esposo Dionicio y su hijo Justin.  
Ella se dedica a varias actividades. Heredó los terrenos de su madre donde siembra diversos productos; también cría animales (vacas, cerdos y ovejas), de los que obtiene un ingreso extra cuando los comercializa. Pero su principal actividad, es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad en un espacio que acondicionó, desde hace 12 años, en su casa. Desde ahí, todas las mañanas, vende diversos productos para sus vecinos, como arroz, pan y frutas en general. Comenzar con la tienda fue muy difícil, según comenta, pues no tenía el capital suficiente para poder comprar todo tipo de alimentos, por lo que poco a poco, juntaba su capital, ahora solo compra lo necesario, pues con las ganancias se abastece ella misma. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Cruz de espinas” y este es su décimo crédito con MFP. En todos estos años de trabajo, obtuvo buenos resultados en su negocio, por lo que se encuentra agradecido. Por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, y además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación, pues se apoyan y son como una familia.
Haydee invertirá este dinero en la compra de sacos de azúcar, arroz, bebidas y verduras para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Haydee is 38 years old.  She has been living in her in-laws' home, in the town of Huancas, with her husband Dionicio and son Justin for 13 years.

Haydee works in a number of different business activities.  She inherited land from her mother where she grows a range of crops.  She also raises animals (cows, pigs and sheep) which makes her extra income when she sells them.  However, her main business activity is selling basic food products in a space that she set up 12 years ago in her home.  Every morning she sells a variety of different products to her neighbors such as rice, bread and fruit.  She recounts that it was very difficult setting up her store because she didn't have enough capital to buy all kinds of food.  However, she gradually got together enough capital.  Now she only buys the essentials and uses the profits to re-stock.

Haydee belongs to the 'Cruz de Espinas' (Crown of Thorns) community bank and this is her tenth loan from MFP.  Over all the years she has been working, she has obtained good results from her business and she is grateful for that.  She pledges to be punctual in making her repayments and she enjoys being a member of her association because they support each other and are like family.  Haydee will invest this money in buying sacks of sugar and rice, drinks and vegetables for her store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, drinks and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Mahugnon Sylvestre

texts.fr: Mahugnon Sylvestre est âgé de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Mahugnon Sylvestre a arrêté l’école au niveau universitaire et est célibataire. Mahugnon Sylvestre vit seul et assure seul ses différents besoins. Mahugnon Sylvestre a appris l’élevage des lapins et la fabrication des purs waters. Il y a  près de sept ans que  Mahugnon Sylvestre exerce cette activité à son domicile pour assurer ses besoins. Mahugnon Sylvestre s'approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Mahugnon Sylvestre sollicite une troisième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les  deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mahugnon Sylvestre is 38 years old and lives in Bénin. He quit school at university level and is single. Mahugnon Sylvestre lives alone and covers his own expenses. He has had training in raising rabbits and in making purified water.
He has been doing this as a business for almost seven years from home, as a way of meeting his income needs. He buys his supplies in Nigeria.
With the goal of meeting his customers' needs and to increase his turnover, Mahugnon Sylvestre is requesting financial support for the third time from ALIDé. The two previous loans have both been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy rabbits.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 56 años. Desde hace 36 años vive en la casa que compró en la localidad de Huancas; junto a su esposo Daniel y uno de los ocho hijos que tuvo, Dora.   
Vivir en el campo es lo que más le gusta, su actividad desde hace 18 años es la agricultura. Cuenta que le fue muy difícil comenzar a adquirir sus terrenos agrícolas, por lo que su madre le heredó en los que ahora siembra papa, habas, trigo, cebada y maíz. Poco a poco comenzó a ganar experiencia en la comercialización, ahora sabe que los meses de mayo a julio, llegan los comerciantes de todo el país a comprar las mejores cosechas de los distintos agricultores, por ello cuida mucho que sus cultivos sean de buena calidad. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la crianza de vacas, tiene 10, las cuales produce la leche que comercializa a los ganaderos. Y además tiene un negocio de compra y venta de animales menores como ovejas y cerdos. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Cruz de espinas” y este es su octavo crédito con MFP. Y en todos estos años de trabajo obtuvo buenos resultados en su negocio, por lo que se encuentra agradecida. Por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, y además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación, pues se apoyan y son como una familia.
Paulina invertirá este dinero en la compra de semilla de papa del tipo “canchan y única”, además de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos cuando se encuentren creciendo.
texts.en:
Paulina, 56, has lived for 36 years in the house she bought in the town of Huancas, with her husband, Daniel, and one of their eight children, Dora.  Living in the country is what she likes best and she has been in the farming business for 18 years.  She says that it was hard to get started when she inherited the farmland where she now grows potatoes, lima beans, wheat, barley and corn.  Little by little she acquired experience in commerce and now she knows that in the months of May through July, traders from all over the country buy the best harvests from the different farmers.  Therefore, she takes special care with her crops so they will be of top quality.  She also has ten dairy cows and sells milk to farmers.  And she buys and sells smaller livestock such as sheep and pigs.

She belongs to the communal bank "Cruz de espinas" and this is her eighth loan through MFP.  Business has been profitable over the last few years, for which she is grateful.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and enjoys belonging to her association, because all the members are supportive and like family.

Paulina will use the loan to buy potato seeds of the varieties "canchan" and "única", as well as natural fertilizer to spread on the crops when they begin to grow.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 44 años. Su esposo es Lauro desde hace 25 años. Vive con tres de sus cinco hijos. Su casa es propia, la que compró hace 7 años.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años, siembra papa, habas, maíz y alfalfa en terrenos que le fueron heredados de su madre. Cada cosecha la comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad, donde ya tiene clientes fijos. Además, tiene 30 cuyes, “ahora tengo solo esa cantidad, pues vendí unos, pero muy pronto aumentarán”, comenta. Su granja es muy organizada, tiene reproductores para poder aumentar la cantidad de los animales. Ahora, desea mejorar sus ingresos, porque sus hijos crecen y desea brindarles una buena educación.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. Le gusta trabajar en su grupo, pues las personas que lo conforman son responsables y siempre se apoyan entre sí en cada reunión. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. 
Natividad invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Natividad is 44 years old and has been married to Lauro for 25 years.  They live with three of their five children and own their own home which they bought seven years ago.

Natividad has been farming for three years.  She grows potatoes, beans, corn and alfalfa on land that she inherited from her mother.  She sells each harvest in the town market where she already has regular customers.  In addition, she also has 30 guinea pigs "I only have this number right now because I sold some.  However, the number will increase very soon", she says.  Her farm is very organized and she has breeding animals so that she can increase her number.  Natividad would now like to improve her income because her children are growing and she would like to provide them with a good education.

Natividad belongs to the 'Nuevo Amanecer' (New Dawn) community bank and this is her third loan from MFP.  She enjoys working with her group because the members are responsible and always support each other in every meeting.  For this reason, she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  Natividad will invest this money in buying natural fertilizers to spread over her alfalfa crops..

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers for her alfalfa crops

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela tiene 38 años. Vive, desde hace 13, en la casa que compró en la localidad de Molinos, junto a sus dos hijos; Evelyn y Demi.  
Desde las primeras horas del día sale a los establos donde tiene sus cuatro vacas, de buena raza, pues de ellas depende la ganancia del día. “Cada día ordeño un promedio de 30 a 32 litros de leche, que la comercializo a los recolectores que llegan a mi casa todos los días”, afirma. De esa manera obtiene un ingreso diario que le ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Su secreto es sembrar el pasto natural que comerá su ganado, sus terrenos son fertilizados y cuidados con mucha atención, pues un mal alimento puede matar a la vaca. Es así, que sus animales siempre comen lo mejor. También tiene 40 cuyes, los que vende a los comerciantes de la zona, quienes ya conocen del buen 
cuidado que ofrece y la calidad de los animales. Micaela también se dedica a la venta chupetes en su casa.  

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Las mujeres del milenio” y este es su quinto préstamo con MFP. En todo estos años aprendió a invertir con mucha cautela y disciplina el dinero, por ello obtuvo muchos logros, por ello agradece a su asociación y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  
Micaela invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de una vaca lechera más.
texts.en:
Micaela, 38, has lived for 13 years in the house she bought in the town of Molinos, with her two children, Evelyn and Demi.  In the early morning hours she goes out to the stables where she has four purebred cows, with whom she earns her living daily.  "Every day I milk an average of 30 to 32 liters of milk which I sell to the collectors who come to my house every day", she states.  This is how she earns a daily living to pay for household expenses.  Her secret is growing natural fodder for the livestock.  Her lands are fertilized and cared for with a lot of attention, since bad fodder can kill a cow.  So, her animals always eat the best.  She also has 40 guinea pigs, which she sells to traders in the area who know how well she cares for her animals which are of high quality.  Micaela also sells lollipops from home.

She belongs to the communal bank "Las mujeres del milenio" and this is her fifth loan through MFP.  Over the years she has learned to invest her money with care and discipline, so she has met many goals.  Therefore she is grateful to the association and committed to paying back the loan on time.  Micaela will use the loan to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
Gudelia tiene 36 años. Vive, desde hace 3 años, en la casa de su hermana, junto a sus cuatro hijos pequeños, en la localidad de Yanamarca.  
Ella posee pocos terrenos agrícolas, los que le fueron heredados de su madre, siembra habas, papa, cebada en pocas cantidades, y otros productos para consumo propio. Los días donde no tiene que cuidar de sus cultivos, los dedica a trabajar en otros terrenos agrícolas como peón. Más su principal actividad económica es la cría de animales como cerdos, ovejas y toros, los cuales compra para luego venderlos a un mayor precio entre los carniceros que siempre llegan a su casa. Ahora, por falta de capital, no tiene muchos animales, pero espera poder adquirir la cantidad que requiere para obtener más ganancias.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Las abejitas” y este es su primer crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le otorgan, pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio con este préstamo.
Gudelia invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de un toro nuevo.
texts.en:
Gudelia is 36 years old.  She has been living in her sister's home for three years together with her four young children.  The house is located in the town of Yanamarca.

Gudelia has a few plots of farmland which she inherited from her mother.  She sows beans, potatoes and barley in small quantities and other crops for her own consumption.  On days when she doesn't have to care for her own crops, she works on other people's land as a day laborer.  In addition to her main business activity, Gudelia also raises animals such as pigs, sheep and bulls.  She buys these animals and then sells them at a higher price to the butchers who always visit her home.  RIght now, Gudelia doesn't have many animals owing to a lack of capital.  However, she hopes to acquire the quantity she needs to make more profits.

Gudelia belongs to the 'Las Abejitas' (Little Bees) community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity to make progress that she is being given as she will be able to use this loan to improve her business.  She will invest the money in buying a new bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es:
Antenor tiene 46 años. Vive, desde hace 15 años, en una casa alquilada en la localidad de Huancas, junto a su esposa Carmen y cuatro de sus seis hijos. 
Desde hace 18 años comenzó en la agricultura, sus sembríos de papa están en los terrenos que heredó de su madre. Cuenta que pasó muchos problemas para tener lo que hoy posee, una estabilidad económica, sus sembríos de papa, muchas veces se malograban y no resultaban. “Existían cosechas en las que ganaba y otras en las que perdía lo invertido”, afirma. Es así que comenzó a sembrar quinua, cebada y otras hortalizas, de las que invertía poco y ganaba más. Sus cosechas son reconocidas en el valle, por lo que en cada siembra ya tienen compradores fijos que llegan a su pueblo. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus productos para obtener más ganancias. Espera ahorrar lo suficiente, ya que también se dedica a la crianza de animales como ovejas, cerdos y vacas, las cuales engorda para luego venderlas a un mayor precio.

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Cruz de espinas” y este es su  décimo crédito con MFP. En todos estos años de trabajo obtuvo buenos resultados en su negocio. Por lo que se encuentra agradecido, por ello promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, y además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación, pues se apoyan y son como una familia.
Antenor invertirá este dinero en el pago del alquiler de su terreno agrícola y a los peones que le ayudarán a voltear la tierra para la siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Antenor is 46 years old and has been living in a rental house in the town of Huancas for 15 years.  He lives together with his wife, Carmen, and four of his six children.

Antenor started farming 18 years ago, growing potato crops in land he inherited from his mother.  He says that he experienced many problems in getting where he is today: in a position of financial stability.  His potato crops would often fail and not grow.  "There were harvests which earned me money and others where I lost the money I had invested", he says.  For this reason, he started sowing quinoa, barley and other crops in which he invested less and earned more.  His harvests are well known in the valley which means that he has regular buyers who come to his village every season.  Right now, Antenor would like to improve the quality of his produce so that he can make more profits.  He hopes to save up enough because he also works raising animals such as sheep, pigs and cows, which he fattens and then sells at a higher price.

Antenor belongs to the 'Cruz de Espinas' (Crown of Thorns) solidarity group and this is his tenth loan from MFP.  During all the years he has been working with them he has obtained good results in his business.  For this reason, he feels grateful and pledges to make his repayments on time.  He enjoys belonging to his association because they support each other and are like family.

Antenor will invest this money in paying rent on his farmland and to pay laborers who will help him to turn his soil for sowing corn.

loans.use: to pay rent on his farmland

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo de 49 años,  vive en el suroccidente de la ciudad con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 18 a 23 años de edad. Allí se dedica al comercio de frutas tropicales como aguacates, papaya, banano, los cuales realiza diariamente. Desde sus 28 años de edad llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla desde el departamento de Bolívar, buscando oportunidades de mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Su primer negocio lo emprendió, porque su hermana le dio el primer capital de trabajo, para que generara ingresos, por eso decidió convertirse en un vendedor ambulante de frutas, pues las conocía muy bien,  debido a que se había dedicado al cultivo de ellas en su natal María La Baja. Posteriormente cuando logró reunir un dinero producto de su trabajo, decidió estacionarse en un punto comercial al norte de la ciudad, donde actualmente se encuentra y allí tiene más de 15 años de permanencia, gozando de una clientela fija. Su esposa es la jefe de cocina de un centro comercial, ubicado en el centro de la ciudad y ambos tienen metas compartidas, logrando así la compra de su propia casa, lo cual brinda  seguridad  y estabilidad a su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará frutas como melón, sandia, aguacates, y una carterilla que le permita exhibirlas de manera típica calle a calle. Con su credikiva, logrará aumentar ligeramente su capital de trabajo, así mismo su capacidad de compa y hacer una oferta diversificada de frutas, logrando que muy pronto, todos en el suroccidente de la ciudad puedan comprar sandias, melones, bananos,  limones, naranjas, aguacates a buen precio y con ello hacer ganar dinero a Domingo y a su familia.
texts.en:
Domingo is 49 years old and lives in the south-west of the city with his wife and their three children who are between 18 and 23 years old.  Domingo works there selling tropical fruit such as avocados, papaya and bananas.  He does this work every day.  Domingo arrived in the city of Barranquilla at the age of 28, from Bolívar department, seeking opportunities to improve his quality of life.  He started his first business because his sister gave him some working capital so that he could make income.  He decided to start selling fruit as an itinerant street vendor.  He was very familiar with the fruit as he had grown them in his home town of María la Baja.  Later, when he he had managed to put together a bit of money, he decided to set himself up at a sales location in the north of the city.  He still works there today, 15 years later, and has regular customers.  Domingo's wife is a head chef in a shopping mall in the city center and they both have shared goals.  This is how they bought their home which provides their family with safety and stability.

Domingo is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy fruit such as melons, watermelons and avocados, and a small cart which will allow him to display his wares from street to street.  With his Kiva loan, he will manage to slightly raise his working capital and his purchasing power.  He will offer a diverse range of fruit which means that, soon, everybody in the south-west of the city will be able to buy watermelons, melons, bananas, lemons, oranges and avocados at a good price and this will make money for Domingo and his family.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as melons, watermelons and avocados, and a small cart

loans.name: Nerys

texts.es: Nerys de 53 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas de 17 y 25 años de edad,  en Puerto Colombia, un hermoso lugar a orillas del mar caribe, de vocación turística. Allí en su ambiente de playa, brisa y mar, Nerys tiene su pequeño negocio, mediante el cual se dedica a comercializar productos mediante guías especializadas, siendo su principal línea comercial, la ropa interior femenina. Los clientes de Nerys están ubicados en el municipio de Puerto Colombia y ella les vende a crédito, para pagar en plazos pactados de acuerdo con sus posibilidades de pago. El esposo de Nerys pertenece al cuerpo de bomberos de la ciudad de Barranquilla y también vende extintores y ofrece el servicio de actualización de los mismos en varias empresas; como conoce a muchas personas que son empleadas de estas, les refiere a su esposa y poco a poco ha logrado también aportarle una nueva clientela al negocio de Nerys . Los fines de semana ella tiene otro negocio, que es la preparación y venta de hayacas de pollo, y/o cerdo y/o de tres carnes, los cuales vende entre sus vecinos. De lunes a viernes atiende un hogar de bienestar familiar, auspiciado por el estado nacional y da clases a mujeres lactantes, charlas de salud reproductiva femenina; ella se siente muy feliz con todas las actividades que desarrolla y se define como  una amante del trabajo social. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa interior femenina, aprovechando que  en sus catálogos  aparecen con un descuesto especial y quiere seguir sorprendiendo a su clientela para fidelizarla.
texts.en: 53-year-old Nerys lives with her husband and their two daughters, who are 17 and 25 years old, in Puerto Colombia. This is a beautiful tourist town on the shores of the Caribbean Sea. There, in an atmosphere of beach, [sea] breeze and sea, Nerys has a small business selling products through specialized guides. Her main line is women's underwear. Nerys' customers are in the town of Puerto Colombia and she sells to them on credit. They repay in installments which are arranged according to their ability to pay. Nerys' husband works as a fireman in the city of Barranquilla. He also sells fire extinguishers and offers a service upgrading them for different companies. As he knows many people who work as employees in these companies, he refers them to his wife and he has gradually managed to bring new customers to her business. On weekends, Nerys has another business preparing and selling chicken and/or pork and/or three-meat 'hayacas' which she sells to her neighbors. From Monday to Friday she works in a 'hogar de bienestar familiar' (a community childcare center sponsored by the State), gives classes to breastfeeding mothers and gives talks on women's reproductive health. She feels very happy with all of the activities she is involved in and describes herself as a lover of social work. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) which she will use to buy women's underwear. This will enable her to make the most of some special discounts that are available in her catalogs. She would like to continue surprising her customers in order to gain their loyalty.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es: Gladys de 55 años  vive con su hija de 18 años de edad,  en Puerto Colombia, un hermoso lugar a orillas del mar caribe, de vocación turística. Allí tiene un taller de confecciones y una miscelánea, el cual funciona desde su residencia y produce todo tipo de prendas de vestir, especialmente en la línea  femenina.
